runners.name: Andesite
runners.comment: Both starts at York, winning on debut then seventh in the Gimcrack; should do better yet
runners.spotlight: Both 2yo starts over 6f at York, beating a useful rival at the Dante meeting then taking a step backwards in the Gimcrack; bred to rate higher, being half-brother to a dual Group 2 winner for his connections.

stable_tour.quote: He's a high-class horse. He'll have an entry in the Norfolk Stakes as well ? Steve Parkin [owner whose horses run under the Clipper Logistics banner] was keen to put him in, in case it's a weak race ? but for me the Coventry should be the race. His half-sister Dramatised won the Queen Mary there and the track should hold no fears for him. He looks very exciting. 10-06-24

runners.name: Jouncy
runners.comment: Juvenile campaign featured a close second in Kempton Group 3; gelded since last run
runners.spotlight: Juvenile campaign featured a success in maiden at Glorious Goodwood and close second in Group 3 at Kempton, both over 6f; gelded since last run; useful and is one of only two runners who already have AW experience.

runners.name: Mr Lightside
runners.comment: Useful over 5f on turf last term; doesn't seem to be crying out for this return to 6f
runners.spotlight: Capable of useful form over 5f on turf last term, having made the frame in Listed/Group races at two major festivals; however, doesn't seem to be crying out for this return to 6f (second attempt).

runners.name: Uncle Don
runners.comment: Poorly drawn last time; progressive form otherwise; eyecatcher in Ayr Listed event
runners.spotlight: Hindered by poor draw in the Two Year Old Trophy; showed progressive form otherwise last season and ran well, catching the eye, in Ayr Listed contest the time before; raced only four times and still unexposed.

runners.name: Liberalised
runners.comment: Limitations exposed since debut win; stiff task on ratings
runners.spotlight: Successful in first outing; limitations exposed since, most recently a modest fourth in French Listed event on stable/seasonal debut; stiff task on ratings and easy to oppose.

quotes.race: Sodexo Live 2YO Series Maiden Fillies' Stakes (Hamilton Park 2yo Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Liberalised was impressive. She's been showing us all the right signs at home and she's the sort of filly who does everything so easily. You can never be sure first time out but Karl [Burke, trainer] has got a good gauge on his two-year-olds and she's bound to improve - Danny Tudhope, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Perfect Part
runners.comment: Seemed to run very well against her elders in Doncaster Listed race on reappearance
runners.spotlight: Won the Hilary Needler on debut; 0-5 since but seemed to run very well, despite traffic issues, against her elders in Doncaster Listed race (6f) on reappearance; interesting assuming she backs up that effort.

quotes.race: Hilary Needler Trophy EBF Fillies' Conditions Stakes (GBB/IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: We had Perfect Part out of the stalls two or three times in the last couple of weeks and she came out of them like an absolute rocket. And I saw she was a huge price, I thought they must know something we don't! We thought she was good.  She breezed absolutely brilliantly but she was a late foal and she hasn't got the size. I think that's why I got her so cheap. It was mitigating circumstances - Keith Brown, owner.

stable_tour.quote: I don't see why she shouldn't run well. She won in a time half a second quicker than the colts' race at Beverley. It was a good time and a good race. Sometimes they run green first time out but she was very professional. 10-06-24

runners.name: Sayidah Dariyan
runners.comment: Thrice raced; may do better still and is one of only two runners who bring AW form
runners.spotlight: Not disgraced in Dundalk Listed event (5f) on the back of her wide-margin success at Lingfield (6f); this thrice-raced filly may do better still and is one of only two runners who bring AW form.

stable_tour.quote: We really fancied her at Windsor at the start of the month, but she stumbled over every one of those ridges and it was hard to get her on an even keel. I backed her up just over a week later because it was the ideal race over 6f at Lingfield on the all-weather. I didn't think she'd win like she did and she's gone up in her estimation at home. We might go to Dundalk on October 4 for a Listed race over 5f. 18-09-24

runners.name: Sky Majesty
runners.comment: Unblemished 2yo campaign on turf included Group 3 and Group 2 wins; clear top on ratings
runners.spotlight: Blue Point filly whose unblemished 2yo campaign comprised 6f wins in Newbury maiden, Ayr Group 3 and Chantilly Group 2; clear top on ratings and likely to remain unbeaten provided she takes to AW.

quotes.race: Criterium de Maisons-Laffitte (Group 2) (2yo) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Christophe said Sky Majesty didn't relish the ground, but she handled it. She did really well and the second filly, whether or not she ran to her best I don't know, but she's got some very good form. I don't think she does a lot [when she gets to the front]. She won a nose in her maiden and then a neck in the Firth of Clyde, so it looks like the better the race, the further she wins - William Haggas, trainer.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Every Saturday Money Back Firth Of Clyde (Group 3) (Fillies)
quotes.quote: She's good. She's taken a nice step forward. Sky Majesty picked up great when I asked and showed a great attitude when it mattered - Callum Rodriguez, jockey.

runners.name: Cosi Bello
runners.comment: 38,000gns yearling by Bated Breath; sixth foal; half-brother to four winners
runners.spotlight: 38,000gns yearling by Bated Breath; sixth foal; half-brother to winners Urban Icon (6f/7f including 2yo/AW Listed; RPR 115), Eagle Eyed Tom (8.4f; 74), Flying Foxy (5f; 71) and Parliament Hill (1m7f/2m hurdle/chase); dam 7f-1m2f maiden (38); likely best watched but makes sense to check the betting.

runners.name: Critical Aclaim
runners.comment: Runner-up in both his races; should go well but vulnerable to something really useful
runners.spotlight: Sent off 15-8 for both his runs so evidently held in some regard; last time at Wolverhampton (7f) he couldn't lay a glove on the winner who went on to contest the Greenham (well beaten); should go well but vulnerable to a horse with Vecu's form.

runners.name: Go Out
runners.breeder: S C E A Haras De La Perelle
runners.comment: Beaten about 5l at Newcastle (7f) and Southwell (1m), posting average RPRs
runners.spotlight: Beaten about 5l at Newcastle (7f) and Southwell (1m), posting average RPRs; looks one for handicaps.

runners.name: Maury
runners.comment: Ability on debut; one to keep an eye on for when his sights are lowered
runners.spotlight: Debut run wasn't devoid of promise and then ran in a novice won by Cosmic Year who is a Group-class colt; one to keep an eye on for when his sights are lowered.

runners.name: Regal Guest
runners.comment: Third of 11 at Kempton; needs to take another step forward and that's possible.
runners.spotlight: Improved on debut run to be third of 11 in 7f novice at Kempton three weeks ago; needs to take another step forward and that's possible.

runners.name: Uniting
runners.comment: 250-1 at Doncaster but finished a closing fourth after some bother in running
runners.spotlight: 250-1 at Doncaster (7f) but belied those odds with a highly respectable debut effort, keeping on for fourth after finding some bother in running; has races in him.

runners.name: Vecu
runners.comment: Ran to a good level in three defeats last season and found a good opening here
runners.spotlight: Ran to a good level in three defeats last season and had a Group 1 entry when turned over by a Juddmonte-bred colt at Kempton the final time (7f); a winner waiting to happen and has been found a good opening here.

runners.name: Yafaarr
runners.comment: Has to improve to feature here and handicaps will be more like it
runners.spotlight: Some promise when beaten 6l at Newbury last summer (6f) but was double that margin behind the winner at Kempton (1m) only 11 days ago; has to improve to feature here and handicaps will be more like it.

runners.name: Baby Caitlin
runners.comment: Only ran last week and was tailed off at Lingfield when 100-1 chance; drops back from 1m4f
runners.spotlight: Only ran last week and was tailed off at Lingfield when a 100-1 chance; drops back from 1m4f.

runners.name: Christmas Gift
runners.comment: Newcomer; commands respect on many fronts and the betting should be informative
runners.spotlight: No Nay Never filly and the second foal of a smart 6f/7f winner from the family of a Derby winner; commands respect on many fronts and the betting should be informative.

4:00.race_name: Best Odds Guaranteed At bet365 Handicap (GBBPlus Race)

runners.name: Caballo De Mar
runners.comment: Has another 6lb rise to deal with here but won cosily last time and he's on a roll
runners.spotlight: Won three Class 5s on the bounce and brought up the four-timer in a Class 4 at Southwell (1m6f) with a bit up his sleeve; has another 6lb rise to deal with here but he's on a roll.

quotes.race: Weekly Â£5 Free Bet With BetUK Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
quotes.quote: Caballo De Mar has been a slow burner but has been well placed by George (Scott, trainer). He's uncomplicated and stayed on really well. He should stay further again - Daniel Muscutt, jockey.

runners.name: Vino Victrix
runners.comment: Signed off last year below his best and he's not getting any younger
runners.spotlight: Two of his three wins have been on turf but has comparable form on Polytrack; should be reasonably treated but signed off last year below his best and he's not getting any younger.

quotes.race: Club Godolphin Cesarewitch Handicap (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: Vino Victrix is only four and he's a lovely progressive horse. To be able to do that as a four-year-old is impressive and he should have a good future - Hughie Morrison, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He ran well last time at Goodwood and on his day he's got a big staying handicap in him, possibly this season. He was second in the Cesarewitch 18 months ago, so we'll probably go back for that. 06-06-24

runners.name: Liam Swagger
runners.comment: Capable Flat horse (fine on Polytrack) and third in the Fred Winter at Cheltenham latest
runners.spotlight: Only Flat win came when long odds-on for a 1m4f Tapeta novice in February but then ran a corker to be third in the Fred Winter at Cheltenham; peak Flat RPR came on Polytrack (Kempton) and, in his current form, he's strongly considered.

quotes.race: Hallgarten And Novum Wines Juvenile Handicap Hurdle (Registered As Fred Winter) (Premier Hcap) (GBB)
quotes.quote: It would have been nice if he'd had a smoother passage, but it's a rough race; four-year-old handicappers who have only run in small fields, but Liam Swagger is a brave horse and I'm really pleased with him. He'll have a Flat campaign now. Chester Cup - James Owen, trainer.

quotes.race: Weatherbys nhstallions.co.uk Wensleydale Juvenile Hurdle (Listed Race) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Liam Swagger enjoys his jumping and he relaxed better today than he did last time. His only mistake was the last down the back but he was fantastic three down and two down and very brave at the last. It was good to get his head in front again, he'll have learned a lot more and I hope he'll keep progressing - Sam Twiston-Davies, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He definitely runs in the Boodles and will have a prep run on the Flat at Southwell on Friday. He's done well over hurdles, but struggled to carry the second penalty at Newbury. He's been freshened up since and hopefully Friday's prep will put him spot on for Cheltenham. 18-2-25

It was a good run when he was second at Newbury last time under his big weight. I think the winner's not a bad horse and we got stuck in the mud a bit. He's got a nice mark. He's currently on a break at the stud and will come back in the second week of January. He'll be prepared for the Boodles at Cheltenham and hopefully it'll be good to soft ground, which will really suit him. He'll probably have a Flat run as a prep. 01-01-25

runners.name: Cello
runners.comment: Has knocked on the door a few times but it's hard to call him well handicapped
runners.spotlight: Competitive in defeat from 1m4f to 2m during the winter but latest run wasn't his best (1m4f) and it's hard to call him well handicapped.

runners.name: Knockbrex
runners.comment: Kept on for fourth over 1m4f last time and well worth another go over this far
runners.spotlight: From off the pace he kept boxing on for a close fourth over 1m4f at Kempton last time and he's not had much luck when sent over this far previously; will need some luck if held up from stall 3 but could be interesting if getting the breaks.

runners.name: Java Raja
runners.comment: Disappointing favourite on handicap debut and will have to step up on that
runners.spotlight: 4yo with just four runs behind him, the win coming in a 1m4f maiden on Tapeta; blinkers joined the tongue-tie when sent off favourite for handicap debut at Kempton (1m4f) but had no obvious excuses as he faded late on; will have to step up on that.

runners.name: Steel Tiger
runners.comment: He doesn't look unrealistically handicapped provided he stays this far (not bred to)
runners.spotlight: Had subsequent winners behind when off the mark at the sixth attempt in a 1m4f novice at Newcastle in December; he doesn't look unrealistically handicapped provided he stays this far (not bred to).

runners.name: Cardano
runners.comment: Has become inconsistent and it was a messy race in which he prevailed at Wolverhampton
runners.spotlight: Has become inconsistent and it was a messy race in which he prevailed at Wolverhampton (1m6f); wouldn't be obvious follow-up material in this deeper contest.

quotes.race: Bet Boost At bet365 Handicap
quotes.quote: If you looked at Cardano today he was looking a million dollars and Ben's horses have been running well all year. I remember working this horse when he was at Ian Williams's and he would be working with the likes of Enemy. He's an older horse now, but he still has massive enthusiasm for the game. The tricky thing today was the draw as Ben said he likes it when horses are coming at him. Once I managed to get to the lead he kept galloping and I simply had a massively willing partner - Ali Rawlinson, jockey.

quotes.race: "Grow With Price Bailey" Handicap
quotes.quote: There is more to come from Cardano who was very green in front and is still immature - Robert Winston, jockey.

quotes.race: Genting Casinos At The Cornerhouse Handicap
quotes.quote: Cardano was very green and is still learning the job. He picked up well when the penny dropped and this was a much weaker contest than last time. He did it well and liked the soft ground - Martin Dwyer, jockey.

runners.name: Sixpack

prev_owners.owner: Any Excuse For A Holiday Syndicate

runners.comment: Consistent dual winner in Ireland and left Johnny Murtagh for 52,000gns
runners.spotlight: Won 1m4f/1m6f handicaps in Ireland last summer and consistent afterwards in defeat; left Johnny Murtagh for 52,000gns and has joined another good yard; could be interesting with Tom Marquand booked.

quotes.race: Racing Again Here On June 10th Handicap
quotes.quote: I thought the step up in trip would be a big help to Sixpack. It was a bit of a messy race here last time, they didn't go quick and didn't the gaps when he needed. Everything went to plan today, we went a nice even gallop and I was able to get the gap turning in. I thought he stayed on well to the line and the more racing the better he'll get - Ben Coen, jockey, speaking to Racing TV

stable_tour.quote: I bought him from Johnny Murtagh. He's having a break but I really like him and I think he can compete in the nice Saturday staying races for new owners in the yard. I was keen to go jumping with him but we'll probably do that next year. 01-01-25

runners.name: Don Simon
runners.comment: Improved second on reappearance; should stay this far and Ryan Moore is booked
runners.spotlight: Great pedigree, by Sea The Stars and out of Snow Fairy; well beaten in his one handicap last season when the ground was soft; gelded ahead of his reappearance (1m4f novice) and finished 10l clear of the rest in pushing an odds-on Andrew Balding horse (now 2-2) close; should stay this far and Ryan Moore is booked.

runners.name: Cock And Bull
runners.owner: Wayne And Sarah Dale And Ian Foster
runners.comment: Slow starts are holding him back and stall 1 could spell danger with that in mind
runners.spotlight: 1m4f Polytrack winner and twice successful over 1m6f on turf; ran another competitive race last time at Wolverhampton (1m4f; stays this far) but slow starts are holding him back and with that in mind stall 1 could spell danger.

runners.name: Rakki
runners.comment: Maiden under both codes but nearly won over 1m6f at Sandown last summer
runners.spotlight: Maiden under both codes but hasn't been running badly over hurdles and he nearly won over 1m6f at Sandown last summer off just 2lb lower; could be a factor.

stable_tour.quote: He was a hand smaller than the first two when he third on his jumping debut at Chepstow and he acquitted himself well enough to suggest he can win over hurdles, although he was a shade disappointing at Warwick on Tuesday. He'll stay well and although he could boil over beforehand on the Flat I hope hurdling might put some manners on him. 07-11-24

runners.name: Sugarloaf Lenny
runners.comment: Last year he won three times at up to 1m4f and could be that he needed his comeback race
runners.spotlight: Last year he won three times at up to 1m4f and it could be that he needed his comeback race; has done his winning at a lower level.

quotes.race: Steve Watts 20yrs At Lingfield Park Handicap
quotes.quote: Sugarloaf Lenny got the mile and a half well today, which opens up a few more avenues. He's got an upward profile and the handicapper can't be too harsh, because he's only just winning - William Knight, trainer.

runners.name: Clansman
runners.owner: Mrs C M Clarke, Foulrice Park Racing Ltd
runners.comment: Loves the mud and he's 0-4 on the AW; struggled badly during the second half of last year
runners.spotlight: Loves the mud and he's 0-4 on the AW; struggled badly during the second half of last year; has had wind surgery.

runners.name: Simiyann
runners.breeder: His Highness The Aga Khan's Studs S C
runners.comment: His only wins (both at Wolverhampton) came in 1m6f/2m Class 6 handicaps
runners.spotlight: His only wins (both at Wolverhampton) came in 1m6f/2m Class 6 handicaps; pulled up over hurdles last time and looks up against it.

runners.name: Alright Sunshine
runners.comment: Multiple winner but an exposed 10yo who doesn't arrive here in the best of form
runners.spotlight: Multiple winner but an exposed 10yo who doesn't arrive here in the best of form.

quotes.race: Visit The All New racinguk.com "Junior" Standard Open National Hunt Flat Race
quotes.quote: Alright Sunshine is a nice type who has done it well and should improve plenty for it. He's well-related and they quite like him at home - Brian Hughes, jockey.

5:00.race_name: Each Way Extra At bet365 Handicap

runners.name: Gunlock
runners.comment: Out of the frame in all five handicaps, the last two for this yard; needs a bit more
runners.spotlight: Newcastle maiden winner (1m, Tapeta) for Karl Burke a year ago; out of the frame in all five handicaps, the last two for this yard albeit not beaten far on either occasion; still needs a bit more; hood removed.

runners.name: Midnights Dream
runners.comment: 2-3 so far this year with wins at Kempton and Leicester; 6lb higher but still shortlisted
runners.spotlight: 2-3 so far this year with wins at Kempton (7f, Polytrack)) in January and on turf at Leicester (1m, good to firm) a fortnight ago (fourth has won since); 6lb higher but still one for the shortlist.

runners.name: Westernesse
runners.comment: Doubled his tally at Newcastle last month; not sure an easier 1m is what he wants
runners.spotlight: Had dropped below his previous winning mark when narrowly doubling his tally at Newcastle (1m, Tapeta) last month; 3lb higher mark not the end of the world, but not sure an easier 1m is what he wants.

stable_tour.quote: I was happy with his first run this year and then it was a tactical race last time. I'm not sure about his trip, I've run over a mile and a quarter a few times and we might run him over shorter. He looks progressive. 19-04-24
He's had a couple of setbacks since we bought him two years ago and he has struggled with his consistency. He's on a bit of a break and will be back for the all-weather season. 26-09-24

runners.name: Lessay
runners.comment: Most of his best form has come over 7f, but he does stay this far; drawn wide, though
runners.spotlight: Most of his best form including both wins has come over 7f, but he does stay this far; has plenty on from his wide draw, though.

runners.name: Lord Rapscallion
runners.comment: Not seen often over 1m lately but he stays this far; respected in his hat-trick bid
runners.spotlight: Last six wins have come over 7f including twice here at the end of 2022, but although not seen often over this far lately he did win three times over 1m in Ireland in his younger days; respected in his hat-trick bid from 3lb higher following two months off.

quotes.race: bet365 Bunbury Cup (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: I wanted to get out in a prominent position and I found myself with an easy lead. Once Lord Rapscallion has hit the rising ground he has run on again. He has definitely got a big day in him - Hollie Doyle, jockey.

quotes.race: MansionBet Beaten By A Head Handicap
quotes.quote: Lord Rapscallion never got going at Galway. He is a horse with a lot of ability and a late maturing horse. He is bringing his home work now to the track and it's unbelievable the way Nikita has clicked with him - Johnny Murtagh, trainer.

quotes.race: Crowne Plaza Race & Stay Apprentice Rated Race
quotes.quote: Lord Rapscallion has improved since we put the eyeshields on him. I thought it was going to be a tougher test for him today but he has clicked into gear and the surface suits him well. We might take a chance on a bigger one later in the season - Johnny Murtagh, trainer.

quotes.race: Luke and Nellie Comer Memorial Nursery Handicap (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: Lord Rapscallion has been a bit of a baby but the step up in trip suited him here. Denis said he travelled very well in the race. We'll probably keep him on the go for now - Johnny Murtagh, trainer

stable_tour.quote: He's a very talented horse who joined us in the autumn having been with Johnny Murtagh. He was given a few runs over the winter on the all-weather, where he didn't show much and his handicap mark dropped 10lb. During the spring he finished runner-up at Newmarket and Goodwood behind two nice sorts. He ran in the Buckingham Palace Stakes last week at Royal Ascot and all things considered we were very pleased with his fourth place. He got out well but then was hampered 5f out and after being hit on the nose by a whip 2f out he ran on well. That was very encouraging and now we'll aim to run him in the Bunbury Cup if he gets in. He's clearly a smart handicapper and I think he'll continue to give us a lot of fun. 23-06-21

runners.name: Savvy Exchange
runners.comment: Returns from five months off having been gelded; faces a daunting task from outside stall
runners.spotlight: Won a three-runner Pontefract maiden (1m, soft) just under a year ago, but a mixed bag since going handicapping; returns from five months off having been gelded and faces a daunting task from the outside stall.

quotes.race: Fleet Finders Supports The National Horseracing College EBF Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Danny [Tudhope, jockey] said Savvy Exchange was a bit green when he hit the front, he's not been on grass much. He's a big unit and he'll come on a lot. He's a work in progress and will keep improving - Sean Woods, trainer.

runners.name: Billy Mill
runners.comment: 2lb below last winning mark, but not sure he can take avantage; drawn wider than ideal
runners.spotlight: Has won over this trip at Kempton, but his other five AW wins have come over 7f; 2lb below last winning mark, but not really running well enough to take avantage and drawn wider than ideal.

stable_tour.quote: He's a horse we bought from Richard Hannon. He runs mostly on the all-weather because he wouldn't handle firm ground and he wouldn't go on heavy and we've been pretty successful with him. He loves Newcastle, it's just a shame that my yard is so far away from Newcastle! We've won three races with him up there. He's just a good old horse and very genuine. 11-07-24

runners.name: A Major Payne
runners.comment: 0-5 but had four of these behind when third over C&D last time; considered
runners.spotlight: 0-5, but he ran well on his return from 145 days off when third of 12 over C&D last month with four of these behind; considered off the same mark and with the possbility of further progress.

runners.name: Charming Whisper
runners.owner: Exors Of Serafino Agodino & P J Mcbride
runners.comment: Finished behind three of these over C&D last time and has a high draw to overcome
runners.spotlight: Just 1lb higher than for the latest of two wins on turf (1m, good to firm) last summer, but finished behind three of these over C&D last time and has a high draw to overcome.

quotes.race: Country & Town House Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: The handicapper can't put Charming Whisper up too much and he's always been a nice little horse. He was fresh and boiled over a little bit first time out and he can get a bit warm. He's learning - Charlie McBride, trainer, talking to Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Juddmonte EBF Restricted Novice Stakes (Bands C and D) (EBF Restricted Race Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Charming Whisper was very cheap through the sales ring because he was a rig. We had to take him home and bring him to Rossdales [Newmarket vet surgeons] to have an operation, but he hasn't looked back ever since. I actually didn't realise what a valuable race it was, but it is terrific to pick up this prize-money with such a cheaply bought horse. I think all the owners backed him at 50-1 too! - Charlie McBride, trainer.

runners.name: Commander Of Life
runners.comment: Last 12 starts have come on Tapeta, but has has run well on Polytrack including a win here
runners.spotlight: Last 12 starts have come on Tapeta including a win at Wolverhampton (8.6f) in January, but has has run well on Polytrack including a win here (6f) as a 2yo; worth a second look.

runners.name: Mr Swivell
runners.comment: Makes his stable debut (same owner) after 191 having been gelded; watch market
runners.spotlight: Two wins over 1m on Tapeta/turf last year when trained by James Ferguson; makes his stable debut (same owner) after 191 having been gelded; watch market.

runners.name: Mister Mojito
runners.comment: Bids to make it 3-3 since the tongue-tie went on; stall 15 a major concern
runners.spotlight: 2-2 since the tongue-tie went on with both wins coming at Lingfield (1m/7f); 3lb wrong under a penalty for his win eight days ago, but at least as big a concern is stall 15.

quotes.race: Download The Racecourse App Raceday Ready Handicap
quotes.quote: Mister Mojito is still improving. I was a little disappointed with him last time at Newmarket, I don't think the ground was an issue, I just think he ended up getting behind the wrong horse and tactically we got it wrong. He came out of the race really well and I would have been a little bit disappointed if he wasn't involved today. He doesn't like soft ground but other than that he's not let us down - Terry Kent, trainer, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Mr Mistoffelees
runners.comment: 1-17 under rules; no margin for error off this mark and drawn a bit wider than ideal
runners.spotlight: Sole success came in a Kempton novice (1m, Polytrack) at the end of 2022; running well in defeat on Tapeta since January, but no margin for error off this mark and drawn a bit wider than ideal.

stable_tour.quote: He is a nice handicapper but unfortunately his current mark of 92 is way above where he should be. Having won a mile maiden just before Christmas it was decided to give him a run in one of the Guineas trials (Craven Stakes), where he ran okay but was around eight lengths off the winner. The handicapper then gave us a mark of 92 which is clearly far too high, but I realise they are only doing their job. Clearly horses are penalised for running in races like that as he is now on a very harsh mark, whereas if we had gone for a handicap instead of the Craven he would have been thrown in off 81. They are keen to encourage horses to run in the better races and help nurture good-sized fields but if the price is an 11lb hike then the incentive is not there, and I think they need a re-think and should consider a more considerate approach to horses like Mr Mistoffelees. 17-05-23

runners.name: City Of York
runners.comment: 1lb below his last winning mark, but possible he will need this first start in six months
runners.spotlight: Has dropped 1lb below his last winning mark and may appreciate the return of the hood, but possible he will need this first start in six months.

stable_tour.quote: He's ready to run. He enjoys a bit of juice in the ground and we've kept him on the all-weather. He's a really hard ride but he's more than capable. He should have a good autumn now. 04-09-24

runners.name: Cill Mocheallog
runners.comment: 1-3 when trained in Ireland, but modest in four starts for this yard
runners.spotlight: 1-3 when trained in Ireland, but modest in four starts for this yard; underwent wind surgery before latest outing when behind four of these over C&D; look elsewhere.

runners.name: Star Pupil
runners.comment: Going well this year (312421); may not face much competition for the lead; respected
runners.spotlight: Going well this year (312421) including all-the-way wins over 7f here and at Wolverhampton (8.6f, Tapeta) last time; 5lb higher, but he may not face much competition for the lead and respected under Ryan Moore.

runners.name: One More Dream
runners.comment: Won at Pontefract ten days ago on his first 5f run since August 2022; can go well
runners.spotlight: Dual course winner who was having his first run over 5f since August 2022 when justifying favouritism at Pontefract (good) ten days ago, with the front pair clear; has 5lb penalty on top of his higher AW mark, but needs respect.

stable_tour.quote: He's a decent all-weather horse and has won at Newcastle and Southwell this month and been second twice. He may switch back to turf but dry ground is quite important to him. When he's right he tries very hard and he's the sort who's important to the yard because he can win two or three a year and if every horse did that you'd have an awful lot of winners. He's entered at Newcastle on Friday. 20-03-24

runners.name: Charlie Mason
runners.comment: Won over 6f (turf) last time but he's back to a career-high mark and yet to win at 5f
runners.spotlight: First visit here but has won on Polytrack; running consistently on AW before getting up late on when switched to turf at Leicester (6f, good to firm) a fortnight ago; likely to be thereabouts but a 2lb nudge puts him back to his career-high mark and the drop back to 5f (0-4) asks a question.

runners.name: Dapperling
runners.comment: Useful juvenile but more miss than hit since; first run here and her mark's falling
runners.spotlight: Useful juvenile but only a couple of flashes of that form since (when returning from breaks) and there was only mild promise on her reappearance at Catterick (6f, good) nine days ago; mark continues to fall; course debut.

quotes.race: Weatherbys Super Sprint Stakes (GBB/IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Dapperling ran a blinder and has plenty of speed and a great mentality. She's a nice, scopey filly who is going the right way - Sean Levey, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: She ran a very good race when third the other day at Wolverhampton and travelled well. Physically she's done extremely well and will be a nice filly for the sprint handicaps. She might even get a bit of black type later on in the year. 29-04-24

runners.name: Dicko The Legend
runners.owner: Mrs S Hibbert, Foulrice Park Racing Ltd
runners.comment: Wolverhampton win wasn't far off his best last time but drop back to 5f asks a question
runners.spotlight: Dual course winner who gained due reward for some consistent efforts when winning at Wolverhampton (also 6f, Tapeta) at the start of the month; that wasn't far off a career best but the drop back to 5f asks a question.

runners.name: Nogos Dream
runners.comment: One win and 12 seconds tells a story; form chance though and he gets Ryan Moore first time
runners.spotlight: Not one for the faint-hearted with one win (a 5f Wolverhampton maiden at 4-11 in 2023) and 12 seconds on his scorecard, but he was running well in January and might have just needed it at Kempton (6f) in March after a pause; off another 44 days since but this is a career-low mark and Ryan Moore rides him for the first time.

stable_tour.quote: Some people don't like him but I love him. If every horse in the yard was second nearly every time they ran you'd be happy. He's a bit quirky and we took all the gear off him for Sandown on Saturday, when he finished fourth after getting no luck in running. But that's Nogo, you have to ride him for luck and we didn't get it. He's ultra-consistent and it's just about finding the key to him. 18-09-24

runners.name: Blue Force
runners.owner: John And Tony Jarvis And Partner
runners.comment: 1211 in 5f AW handicaps; up in grade but he's progressing and could well win again
runners.spotlight: Has form figures of 1211 in 5f AW handicaps (all Class 6 on Tapeta), latterly when making a winning return at Southwell three weeks ago; up in grade but that's well earned and he should make a bold bid to land the hat-trick from a good draw.

runners.name: Maharajas Express
runners.comment: Running well and he's still handicapped to be competitive; wide draw a negative
runners.spotlight: Doubled up at Wolverhampton (5f) in February and he's backed that up with two good efforts off his revised mark; drawn wide today but he ran okay on one of his two visits here and is still feasibly treated.

quotes.race: BetUK It's Where The UK Bets Handicap
quotes.quote: I knew they were going to go pretty hard but I was able to sit a little bit further forward than I did last time. Maharajas Express is quite a keen horse but he relaxed nice enough halfway and it took a while to really hit top gear today. I got a bit of luck up the straight but he's very tough and there's more improvement in him - David Probert, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Honour Your Dreams
runners.comment: Faded over 7f last time and had wind surgery since; return to 5f will suit if tuned up
runners.spotlight: 0-14 on AW but he won on his stable debut at Bath (5f, good) in September and also ran well in January when last seen, fading late on to finish third over 7f on Lingfield's Polytrack, after which he had wind surgery; drop back to this trip will suit and he has possibilities if tuned up.

runners.name: Secret Handsheikh
runners.comment: Encouraging return over C&D three weeks ago and could take a step forward from that
runners.spotlight: A respectable 10-60 record includes six wins when making all; 3-11 on AW and he made an encouraging return over C&D three weeks ago, weakening inside the last having pressed a good pace set by Merrimack (second); no surprise if he lasts longer this time and he's well drawn to go forward.

quotes.race: Get Your Ladbrokes Daily Odds Boost Handicap
quotes.quote: Secret Handsheikh was a convincing winner last time and went up 9lb but he loves this surface. He skips off the surface and has such a good attitude - Hollie Doyle, jockey.

runners.name: Merrimack
runners.comment: Second on his last three starts over C&D but needs to break well from stall 10.
runners.spotlight: Made all for back-to-back wins on turf last July, latterly at Yarmouth (5f, good); runner-up on his last three starts over C&D, including last month when making an encouraging return from a 64-day break (Secret Handsheikh fifth); could give it another good go but will need to break sharply from stall 10.

runners.name: Angle Land

prev_owners.owner: K Dasmal, A Rix, R Penney

runners.comment: No win since June but latest start was a step back in the right direction; possibilities
runners.spotlight: 5f specialist but she hasn't won since scoring at Yarmouth (good to firm) last June; took a step back in the right direction over C&D last time, however, and she's dropped to a career-low mark; has won here before and could outrun her likely odds.

quotes.race: QuinBet Daily Free Bet Fillies' Handicap
quotes.quote: Angle Land is a tough filly and that was a good performance with 10st 2lb on her back - Neil Callan, jockey.

runners.name: Aces Wild
runners.comment: Running respectably; should be thereabouts but he'll likely need extra for the win
runners.spotlight: Has been running respectably over 5f at Wolverhampton (all three British wins there) since coming back in February from a break and he ran well on his only visit here, when second (also 5f) last May; needs to find a bit extra but should be on the premises again.

quotes.race: Join Us On Instagram @dundalk_stadium Maiden
quotes.quote: Aces Wild is a fast little horse and he's lightly raced and those kind of sprinters improve with age. We are hopeful he will keep the ball rolling - John McConnell, trainer

5:30.race_name: Best Odds Guaranteed At bet365 Handicap

runners.name: Caspian King
runners.comment: Gelded, tongue tied and up in trip for handicap debut; latest form got a big recent boost
runners.spotlight: Steadily progressive in three qualifying runs last term, culminating in fifth of 11 at Sandown (1m, good) in September, around 3l behind one who now has a mark of 90 and Tuesday's Feilden winner Almeric; gelded and tongue tied for this reappearance and AW/handicap debut; drawn wide but he's bred to get this trip and that last run makes him of firm interest.

runners.name: Notimeforchitchat
runners.comment: New trip should suit and a 3lb nudge for beating a subsequent winner last time looks fine
runners.spotlight: Narrowly won a Kempton novice (1m; made all) in August and secured a 7f win there on his return last month, getting up late on in his third handicap (runner-up has won subsequently); pedigree suggests this trip will unlock more and he should make his presence felt up 3lb under Ryan Moore.

stable_tour.quote: He won really well over a mile at Kempton last time on his second run. He's a big horse, probably 16.1hh, and shouldn't have been able to win as a two-year-old. He's a big, weak horse, but he was very impressive when he won. He's exciting going forward. 18-09-24

runners.name: Cristo
runners.owner: Middleham Park Racing Lxvii And Partner
runners.comment: Runner-up the last twice and this longer trip looks the go; could be the answer
runners.spotlight: Yet to win but a runner-up the last twice, latterly when making a good reappearance at Southwell (1m, Tapeta) last month, again shaping as though this trip would suit; could be the answer to a tight contest.

runners.name: Scarlet Sunset
runners.comment: Didn't get a clear shot at it latest and this shorter trip, with cheekpieces on, may help
runners.spotlight: Won 8.5f Wolverhampton maiden in December and followed up on her handicap debut at that track over 9.5f in February; didn't have things go her way up to 1m4f at Southwell next time and now drops back in trip with cheekpieces added; could well bounce back.

runners.name: Dalmally
runners.comment: Bred to improve for this step up in trip on his handicap debut; has been gelded
runners.spotlight: Not particularly progressive last term but he got off the mark at Brighton (1m, good to soft) on his fourth start, after which he was gelded; now makes his handicap debut and is bred to improve for this step up in trip.

runners.name: Jiffs Army
runners.comment: Not so good in two handicaps since a maiden win; this race is tougher
runners.spotlight: Won a Lingfield maiden (1m) on Polytrack in January but hasn't quite matched that form in two handicaps subsequently, including over C&D last time; others appeal more.

runners.name: Magna Gee Gee
runners.comment: Cheekpieces go on but he needs to find more than of late; others preferred
runners.spotlight: Off the mark when scrambling home on his handicap debut at Wolverhampton (9.5f) in December but has beaten only one horse home in his three subsequent starts; they were admittedly in small fields but this looks competitive and he's still 2lb above his winning mark; cheekpieces added.

runners.name: Dapper Gee Gee
runners.comment: Small step back in the right direction last time but drawn widest today; stable debut
runners.spotlight: Made a fine start when second of 16 at Chepstow (7f, good to soft) in August but hasn't matched that, including when eighth on AW/handicap debut last time; that was a small step back in the right direction, though, and he is up in trip for this stable debut (has left Dylan Cunha); drawn widest.

runners.name: Phrygia
runners.comment: Handicap debut and breeding suggests new trip may help; hood removed
runners.spotlight: Hooded all previous starts; promising debut at Wolverhampton in January but downhill since, including when always behind at this track (also 7f) in February last time; dam was placed over 1m2f/1m4f, however, and this 3yo now makes her handicap debut up in trip with the hood off, which could be positives.

runners.name: Golden Garden
runners.comment: Gelded ahead of this handicap debut and new trip could suit; market check required
runners.spotlight: Similar form in a maiden and novice (both 1m) the last twice, latterly behind two useful sorts at Southwell in December; gelded since and this new trip could help on his handicap debut; interesting, particularly if the market speaks positively.

runners.name: Say What You See
runners.comment: Hampered last time and should have more to offer over this trip
runners.spotlight: Scored by a wide margin on his handicap debut at Newcastle (1m, Tapeta) in November and was turning in a good effort under a penalty when hampered at Redcar (1m, soft) four days later; 2lb higher but he shapes like this step up in trip will suit and should go well.

runners.name: Anthropologist
runners.comment: Flopped last time and others are less exposed; has been gelded
runners.spotlight: Broke his duck at the eighth attempt, when keeping on for a neck success at Newcastle (1m, Tapeta) in November; flopped off 3lb higher later that month and now makes his return off the same mark having been gelded; well drawn and bred more for 1m2f+ but others might have more potential.

runners.name: Navid
runners.comment: Tailed off last time; questions to answer on his handicap debut up in trip
runners.spotlight: Modest form in four starts last term and tailed off at Nottingham (about 1m; subsequently gelded) in October when last seen; heavy ground was possibly an excuse for that run and he's now up in trip on handicap debut; still has a good bit to prove.

runners.name: Is I Right
runners.comment: Third run was a step up; quiet handicap debut; new trip and cheekpieces for AW debut
runners.spotlight: Took a firm step forward on his final qualifying run when third of six at Haydock (1m, soft; 50-1) in September; not so good on his handicap debut (7f; 40-1) one month later and now tries a new trip on his AW debut with cheekpieces enlisted.

runners.name: Glenridding
runners.comment: Short of room and eased last time; this is competitive but he may do better
runners.spotlight: Made a winning handicap debut at Yarmouth (1m, good to firm) in September and didn't get the breaks on his reappearance over C&D three weeks ago; this is competitive but he may have more to offer.

runners.name: Shielas Well
runners.comment: Exposed off this sort of mark and there are improvers lurking here; last two days ago
runners.spotlight: Exposed filly who went back-to-back when scoring at Newcastle (Tapeta) and Musselburgh (good) over a mile in September; higher marks have proved her undoing since; last of six at Beverley (1m2f, good; weakened) on Wednesday.

2:50.race_name: Watch Live Racing At bet365 Handicap (Div I)

runners.name: Zu Run
runners.comment: Last two runs have been underwhelming but he's on a perfectly good mark if bouncing back
runners.spotlight: Won his novice over C&D and added a 7f handicap at Wolverhampton in October; his last couple of runs have been underwhelming but he's on a perfectly good mark if bouncing back.

quotes.race: Ire-Incentive, It Pays To Buy Irish Novice Stakes (GBB Race) (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: It all happened a bit too quickly for Zu Run on his debut at Salisbury over the six furlongs. He missed the break and got unbalanced at times but I felt that he hit the line well enough for an extra furlong to help him and that's exactly what happened here. He showed a good attitude to the line and it's nice that he's taken a good step forward from that first experience - David Probert, jockey.

runners.name: Sir Maxi
runners.comment: Hold-up horse; Jamie Spencer a notable booking and could threaten if getting the breaks
runners.spotlight: Drawn wide but he's a hold-up performer who won over C&D last month and might have followed up with a clearer run at Wolverhampton; Jamie Spencer a notable booking and could threaten if getting the breaks.

quotes.race: Betway Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: Sir Maxi has been doing everything lovely at home, he does tend to be a small bit keen and he was kind of hanging out around the bends because he's trying to pull too hard and go too quick for himself. As soon as they turned in I just needed him to switch onto that right lead and as soon as he did he quickened away nicely. All he's done this year is only a bonus for what he could be next year, we've always looked at him as being a three-year-old - Rossa Ryan, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Bint Havana Gold
runners.owner: Alan & Christine Bright And John Henwood
runners.comment: In form and ran well from a wide draw here last time; stall 16 is horrible
runners.spotlight: Has spent a lot of her career sprinting but she won over this far at Wolverhampton and was second here off this mark in February despite a wide draw; has again been unlucky in that respect; Ryan Moore booked.

stable_tour.quote: She had a bit of a setback but she'll win again in her grade. We're thinking of stepping her up to 7f one day. 18-09-24

runners.name: Prefer The Sister
runners.comment: Back into a Class 6 for the first time since winning at Kempton; non-runner
runners.spotlight: Only 4lb higher than for a clearcut win at Kempton the week before Christmas (7f) and now back in a Class 6 for the first time since; close up two runs back and could have a role to play; non-runner.

runners.name: Call Glory
runners.comment: Not all doom and gloom during his losing run but this a belated first run beyond 6f
runners.spotlight: Won twice as a 2yo but now on a losing streak of 19; it's not all been doom and gloom but this is a belated first run beyond 6f.

runners.name: Rhythmic Acclaim
runners.comment: Downgraded after a good run but she's been no closer than 5l in four previous tries at 7f
runners.spotlight: Below her last winning mark and showed the benefit of her comeback race when chasing home a well-treated winner in a Class 4 at Yarmouth; this represents a fall in grade but it was over 6f last time and she's been no closer than 5l in four previous tries at 7f.

runners.name: Split Elevens
runners.breeder: Saleh Al Homaizi & Imad Al Sagar
runners.comment: Multiple winner since last summer and this is his trip; another solid effort last time
runners.spotlight: Multiple winner since last summer and this is his trip; another solid effort last time and has form here; should feature.

stable_tour.quote: He's a bit of a character who tends to hold a bit back for himself. That said, he has done very well this season with three wins and is now 9lb higher than at the start of the year. I hope we can squeeze some more improvement out of him, possibly over a mile, as his only run when stepped up from 7f to that distance was a winning one last month at Brighton. 23-09-22

runners.name: Poetic Force

prev_owners.owner: S Barton & Exors of the Late W McLuskey

runners.comment: Hasn't won for a good while now and will do well to put that right from stall 15
runners.spotlight: Veteran who hasn't won for a good while now and will do well to put that right from stall 15; non-runner.

quotes.race: MansionBet Beaten By A Head Claiming Stakes
quotes.quote: Tony (Carroll) thought Poetic Force would need the run after such a long layoff so fair play to him. They didn't go any pace which helped. David Probert - Jockey

quotes.race: 32Red Casino Handicap
quotes.quote: We have not had Poetic Force that long and I am still learning about him in some ways. He has done that well and is the type we will keep going on the grass when the spring comes - Tony Carroll, trainer.

quotes.race: Betway Middle Distance Handicap
quotes.quote: I've ridden Poetic Force at home and he has a nice turn of foot. They didn't go mad and I thought it played into our hands - George Downing, jockey.

quotes.race: 32Red.com Claiming Stakes
quotes.quote: Poetic Force went up 9lb for winning which we thought was a bit harsh so we dropped him to a claimer. This is his trip and he'll get further - Jonathan Portman, trainer.

quotes.race: 32RedSport.com Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: Poetic Force had a good draw and was very straightforward.  The race worked out nicely just having a tow off the leaders.  Adam's horse picked up but my lad always had it covered - Richard Kingscote, jockey.

runners.name: Harry Magnus
runners.comment: Dual winner for Charles Hills who has hurtled down the weights for good reason
runners.spotlight: Dual winner for Charles Hills who has hurtled down the weights for good reason; returns from his third wind operation inside 12 momths.

quotes.race: Best Odds Guaranteed At bet365 Handicap
quotes.quote: I think that was the ride of the meeting. Harry Magnus was drawn one at Goodwood first time out and he jumped right away from the field and he was then in no man's land. Seven furlongs suits him well but he has got a bit of speed. We could drop him back in trip as he might get quicker. He has been a bit green learning his job and he is not fully there yet - Charles Hills, trainer.

runners.name: Capuchinero

prev_owners.owner: Middleham Park X, Simon Wood & A Haynes

runners.comment: C&D winner who went close at Wolverhampton three starts back; has a good draw
runners.spotlight: C&D winner who went close at Wolverhampton three starts back; below that level since but could go well from a handy draw.

quotes.race: Book Online At dundalkstadium.com Claiming Race
quotes.quote: Capuchinero is genuine and tough. She has won two now and she is sound and tries. She is a good fun horse for the winter - Brendan Powell, assistant trainer

stable_tour.quote: This lovely filly was bred by Chasemore Farm and we managed to get one run into her last autumn when third in a 7f novice at Newmarket, where the form has been boosted by the fourth horse winning twice since. She is training nicely and will definitely get a mile. I hope she will prove a nice filly for owner Andrew Black and I am looking at a median auction maiden at Catterick on April 6. 30-03-22

runners.name: Forever Proud
runners.comment: Forgiven last run and was close up the time before; on a perfectly fair mark; new headgear
runners.spotlight: Disappointing favourite in a seller last time but that was only four days after finishing close up in an 8.6f handicap at Wolverhampton; defied a 1lb higher mark over this trip at Kempton in January; new headgear today.

quotes.race: Unibet More Extra Place Races Fillies' Handicap
quotes.quote: Forever Proud doesn't do an awful lot when she hits the front but if something rallied I always thought she'd go again. It was a very different scenario tonight, she's been running over an extended mile at Wolverhampton - that suits her very well - and I had slight reservations about 7f round here, but she's in such a good vein of form at the moment and all credit to James [Owen, trainer] and the team, they'e got her spot on - Hector Crouch, jockey, talking to Racing TV.

stable_tour.quote: She's been very busy. She won at Chelmsford on December 19, then was second at Wolverhampton a couple of days later and then we ran her again at Wolverhampton on December 27 before the handicapper put her up and she won again. She's always shown her best form at Lingfield and it took me a while to work out how to train her really, but we've tweaked a few things and got to the bottom of that. We're looking forward to getting her back to Lingfield in January and I think her form will step up again when she gets back there. 01-01-25

runners.name: Shot Of Love
runners.comment: Front-runner; continues to fall in the weights but losing run is mounting up
runners.spotlight: Front-runner; continues to fall in the weights but losing run is mounting up and little sign of late to believe that's about to change.

stable_tour.quote: He had a couple of runs at the Curragh for Ger Lyons and didn't show much. He joined us at the back end and, although I have yet to get his head in front, he's showing some ability. Unfortunately he had been a bit coltish, so we've gelded him and he seems much better. I think that should bring out plenty of improvement from him. It's hard to know what his trip is, but he doesn't jump out as a sprinter and is more likely to run over a mile next. 22-03-23

runners.name: Thomas Equinas
runners.comment: Produced another good run here 22 days ago when reeled in late on; in the mix
runners.spotlight: Exposed but on a dangerous mark and produced another good run here 22 days ago when reeled in late on; in the mix.

runners.name: Charlatan
runners.comment: Deserves a change of luck; needs a mile ideally but a fast pace would help in that respect
runners.spotlight: Hold-up performer who hasn't been getting much luck in his races and that was again the case when dropped to 7f last time at Wolverhampton; probably needs a mile ideally but a fast pace would help in that respect.

runners.name: Delta Legend
runners.comment: Dual winner but no closer than fifth in four runs for this one, from 1m to 1m6f
runners.spotlight: 1m handicap wins at Lingfield for two different yards; no closer than fifth in four runs for this one, from 1m to 1m6f; others preferred.

runners.name: Spirit La Adelita
runners.comment: Hasn't shown much and was 125-1 when unseating at start last time; new stable
runners.spotlight: Hasn't shown much and was 125-1 when unseating at start last time at Wolverhampton; headgear left off after break and change of stable.

3:25.race_name: Watch Live Racing At bet365 Handicap (Div II)

runners.name: Dark Dreamer
runners.comment: Two 6f wins on AW and turf in 2024; well beaten for new yard; best watched on first 7f run
runners.spotlight: Two 6f wins on Kempton Polytrack and turf for Robert Cowell but he went off the boil on final starts for him and hasn't showed up in two runs for new yard; best watched on first 7f run.

runners.name: My Mate Mike
runners.comment: Three 7f AW wins in 2024; wouldn't enter stalls in January; pulled up over hurdles latest
runners.spotlight: Three AW wins at 7f in 2024 but he refused to enter the stalls in January and has been hurdling for new yard since, pulling up on latest attempt 17 days ago; questionable what his mindset will be after those experiences and he goes without his regular hood.

runners.name: Enpassant
runners.comment: Off the mark on AW at Kempton (7f) then creditable 3rd over C&D; down in grade back at 7f
runners.spotlight: Gained first AW win over 7f at Kempton in February off this mark then a creditable third to an improver over C&D later that month; not quite in the same form since but better expected back at 7f and down in grade.

runners.name: Amaysmont
runners.comment: Has won three of his last four runs here, at 6f and 7f; interesting if getting run of race
runners.spotlight: Below best back on turf last month but he's more interesting on the AW and has won three of his last four course starts, at 6f and 7f; solid form chance off fair mark if getting the run of the race.

runners.name: Macanudo
runners.owner: Giddy Up You Good Thing Racing Syndicate

prev_owners.owner: S Beetham And DPL Fab Ltd

runners.comment: Course winner at 5f; handily weighted on best 2024 form; fair 4th on rare 7f run last time
runners.spotlight: Won 5f novice here last February; handily weighted on the form of some tight finishes over sprint trips later and he appeared to stay 7f well enough on rare attempt at the trip when fourth at Wolverhampton last month; worth giving him the benefit of the doubt that he can do it again.

runners.name: Bellagio Man
runners.comment: 7f winner in Ireland in 2021; better known as a sprinter now; faded back at 7f in March
runners.spotlight: A 7f winner in Ireland four years ago but better known as a sprinter these days and he didn't find anything back over 7f at Newcastle two runs ago; has it to prove on course debut.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Median Auction Maiden (Plus 10 Race) (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: It was a good performance and Bellagio Man had to be brave. He had a terrible draw but it helped that the favourite got stuck in the stalls. Fair play to Colin and the horse as they took advantage of that. He's still a green horse and will improve from it. He was in front a long way from home and it was a fair performance. He wouldn't ideally like that ground, it went a bit slow, and we were a bit nervous before the race with the heavy showers yesterday and today. He's a good ground horse but because it was the first race we said we'd take our chance and we got away with it - Shane Lyons, assistant trainer.

runners.name: Once Adaay

prev_owners.owner: Mrs A M Sturges , Ilka Gansera-Leveque

runners.comment: Last 3 AW wins have come on this track; 4lb lower than the latest of them but drawn wide
runners.spotlight: The latest three of four AW wins have come on this track, at 7f and 1m; quite attractively treated now, off 4lb lower than his latest win, but others have been luckier with the draw.

runners.name: Antiphon
runners.comment: All wins at sprint trips; out of sorts this year but mark is crashing; first 7f run
runners.spotlight: Has done his winning at sprint trips, including here, but nothing noteworthy since returning from a break this year and this first 7f run doesn't entice; still one to keep an eye on, though, as his mark heads south.

quotes.race: Star Property Group Handicap
quotes.quote: Antiphon is a legend of a horse, just so easy to train and he's run seven times for us since we bought him in February and he hasn't been out of the winner's circle. From where we were stood on the stands it looked like we'd been touched off, but he's so tough - Michael Keady, joint-trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He is a lovely colt who made a pleasing debut when third at Newmarket's Craven meeting over 5f. Unfortunately, he had a niggly issue subsequently and will not be out for a while. He looks a proper hardy two-year-old. He will be back later this summer. 19-05-21

runners.name: Kondratiev Wave
runners.comment: Four wins in 2024, one over C&D; has share of weight but running well; bang there
runners.spotlight: Ended a long losing run last June and went on to add three more races, one over C&D; 5lb higher than for the latest of them but three tight finishes show he can add another in the right company; has more going for him than most.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Maiden (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: Kondratiev Wave had plenty of pace we thought. He might prefer a little bit further but with the soft ground his stamina came into play. We've always liked him - Kieran Cotter, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's been very good this year, winning twice and finishing in the first three another four times. He ran last night at Chelmsford in the 7f handicap. 07-08-24

runners.name: Mashaan
runners.comment: Two 7f AW wins this winter; below best latest; now 9lb higher and drawn widest
runners.spotlight: Added two AW wins this winter, over 7f at Wolverhampton and Lingfield, but he couldn't take advantage of favourable terms in a 6f classified at the former track since; now 9lb higher and has the widest draw of all.

stable_tour.quote: We got him from Richard Fahey as an 18-race maiden, but the change of scenery certainly did him some good as he won at the second time of asking and followed that up three weeks later at Chelmsford. Those were both on the all-weather, but he will be just as effective on the turf, especially with a bit of cut in the ground. He pings the gate like a greyhound, but last time out at Doncaster, back on turf, they had not watered, and it was good to firm which was no good to him. To bring out the best in him he needs some ease on a turning track. As for trip, I think he's at his best over 7f on a turning track like Chester, or alternatively a stiff 6f on a straight course. 04-05-22

runners.name: Twitch
runners.breeder: P I Foreman & S A Sharrock

prev_owners.owner: Patrick Ting Siu Yin & Timothy Ting Hao Feng

runners.comment: Same mark as the latest of two C&D wins in September; didn't run near best here latest
runners.spotlight: Back on the same mark as the latest of two C&D wins in September; made a respectable return from break last month but he might have run better back here this month and he's got enough on his plate this time.

runners.name: Triggered
runners.comment: Latest wins were four in 2023; in good form over 7f of late; can be involved again
runners.spotlight: Losing run goes back to 2023 but he won four times that year, including over C&D, and his recent form over 7f elsewhere gives every indication he'll be involved this time as well.

quotes.race: Best Racing Odds Guaranteed At BetMGM Handicap
quotes.quote: Triggered travelled through the race well and picked up good. We went very quick but he won well in the end - Billy Loughnane, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Windsor Pass
runners.comment: Two good C&D runs in January, beating Mashaan in the 2nd; needs race to go her way
runners.spotlight: Two good runs over C&D in January, winning the second of them from Mashaan (who has more to do at these weights) but she was never involved after a slow start back here in March; has since run well over 1m at Yarmouth (1m) but she needs the race to go her way from this draw.

runners.name: Lilkian
runners.comment: Made all over C&D this month; couldn't lead next time;  pace-setting tactics possible here
runners.spotlight: Was having a rare run at 7f when seizing the initiative and holding on over C&D (first-time eyeshield) this month but he couldn't lead and dropped right out at Lingfield last week; 5lb higher than for the win but pace-setting again could work from draw near the rail.

runners.name: Lord Danielson
runners.comment: Both wins over 6f here; mixed 7f record but better latest; could be competitive
runners.spotlight: Both wins over 6f here; mixed record over 7f and finished behind Windsor Pass and Mashaan over C&D in January but he returned from a short break with a good effort at Lingfield (7f); competitive if repeating it.

runners.name: Venus Slipper
runners.comment: Off the mark over 1m2f at Lingfield in February; poor turf run latest; squeak back on AW
runners.spotlight: Had C&D maiden form for previous yard but she stays much further and was a handy winner over 1m2f at Lingfield in February before running another sound race there next time; ran poorly on turf (1m) since but has a squeak back at this trip.

4:42.race_name: BetUK All-Weather Championships Marathon Handicap (GBBPlus Race)

runners.name: Roaring Legend
runners.breeder: S C E A Marmion Vauville Et Al
runners.comment: Improving having gone 3-3 since joining Hugo Palmer; hosed up in a trial for this
runners.spotlight: Dual winning hurdler but an improving Flat performer having gone 3-3 since joining Hugo Palmer and it was all very straightforward in a trial for this at Lingfield; could easily deal with the 8lb rise and has winning form here.

quotes.race: BetUK AWC Marathon Trial Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
quotes.quote: Roaring Legend is really improving. He's taken a massive step forward since winning at Newcastle last time and Hugo is delighted with him. He got into a nice, even rhythm and I went forward going down the hill. He lengthened well and he's got a big engine. He gave me a nice feel and could progress into a Cup horse - David Probert, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He's been a wonderful addition to the yard. Everybody who rides him jokes that they'd pay to ride him every day. He's improved enormously, winning three times since joining us and switching back to the Flat. He may well get further than the two miles we've been campaigning him over. He'll go to Newcastle on Good Friday, when he'll have to give them all weight, and I'd have thought he'd be near enough favourite. The Melbourne Cup is the dream, so we'll need to qualify him for that and the Ormonde Stakes looks an obvious spot for him, although I've also put him in the Yorkshire Cup in case it comes up very soft at Chester. 09-04-25

He made his debut in December when runner-up at Wolverhampton and followed with two similarly encouraging efforts over a mile. He has subsequently been gelded and I think he will be more effective on turf. He shows us speed at home but I think he is looking more like a 1m2f horse. I am happy with his opening mark of 78 and it would be wonderful to win a couple of races hopefully progressing onto better things. 29-03-23

runners.name: Wonder Legend
runners.comment: Had the run of things at Wolverhampton last time but up just 4lb and now 3-4 on Tapeta
runners.spotlight: Record of 4-12; admirably consistent on the AW and made it 3-4 on Tapeta when winning unchallenged from Plage De Havre over 1m6f at Wolverhampton last month; fair to say he got the run of things that day under a positive ride but, off just 4lb higher, he's not easily knocked; stays 2m.

stable_tour.quote: He is a nice individual who has had two runs, the most recent at Kempton in February when second over a mile, which is definitely his minimum trip. I will possibly go and try to win over a mile and then head down the handicapping route. I could see him progressing to being an effective 1m4f handicapper in time. I know he has not won yet so you may find it an odd comparison but at this stage of his career, but if I have a horse in the yard that is similar to Deauville Legend then it is him. At this time last year the âDeauville' was second on the all-weather, just as was âWonder' was at Kempton last time. And we know that âDeauville' progressed all through the year and this one could be the same. Their physicality is also similar in that they are both big, strong colts and I would love to see him win a big handicap somewhere and then the world could be his oyster. 29-03-23

runners.name: Duke Of Oxford
runners.owner: A Cope, B Roberts And J Biggane
runners.comment: 6lb lower when runner-up in this 12 months ago but was still improving late last year
runners.spotlight: 6lb lower when runner-up in this 12 months ago but was still improving late last year, winning two 2m handicaps at Kempton; did well in the latest from off the pace and he's only 3lb higher; expected to be involved.

runners.name: Plage De Havre
runners.comment: Progressive 4yo and Wonder Legend got first run when beaten by him at Wolverhampton
runners.spotlight: Well-bred 4yo in top hands and still lightly raced; went up 9lb for winning over 1m4f here on penultimate start but still ran well behind Wonder Legend at Wolverhampton (1m6f) in a race that panned out none too favourably (winner got first run); remains capable of better.

runners.name: Tritonic
runners.comment: Hard to win with now and never dangerous back on the Flat three weeks ago at Kempton (2m)
runners.spotlight: Fine servant to his team but hasn't got his head in front since winning a four-runner chase in late 2023; 33-1 and never dangerous back on the Flat three weeks ago at Kempton (2m).

quotes.race: Kingwell Farm Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Tritonic has jumped super and it's opened up a lot more doors for us. We'll have a bit more fun with him. He's been a great horse. He's versatile but he's got that bit of class too - Alan King, trainer.

quotes.race: Close Brothers Adonis Juvenile Hurdle (Grade 2) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We wanted to get a bit more experience into Tritonic and he'll have learned plenty on the inside today. Once or twice he goes to sleep, but as soon as Adrian gives him a squeeze he's back on the bridle - I couldn't be more pleased with him. We gave him a proper holiday after the last Flat season - he was gelded and had six weeks in the field. He was only just ready to start at Ascot, but I felt we had to get two runs into him if he was a Triumph horse. We were going to come straight here, but I thought that wasn't right and he needed more experience. He's the highest class Flat horse I've sent jumping. He's not slow and will have the gears to hold a position at Cheltenham. I loved the way he went away from the last - Alan King, trainer.

quotes.race: bet365 Juvenile Hurdle (Novices' Championship Hurdle Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Tritonic was quite keen with me early and just over racing for the first mile. I had to sit and suffer a bit going up the hill and the eventual runner-up ended up getting quite a stretch on me but I was confident from the turn in I was going to reel in the two in front of me, albeit it was a little harder work that I expected. He showed plenty of grit and determination and I'd say it rode like a fair race. He only missed one hurdle and he was brave up the home straight and I'd say he got the better of a very tough rival - jockey Adrian Heskin.

stable_tour.quote: He stays well on the Flat but I don't think he gets two and a half miles over hurdles; jumping seems to light him up and he almost travels too well. He had a difficult task with 12st in the Silver Trophy at Chepstow, but we're probably going to give him one more run then take him back to Ascot just before Christmas for the big 2m handicap he won three years ago. He retains plenty of ability and seems to have got sharper. 25-10-24

He had a difficult task with 12st in the Silver Trophy at Chepstow anyway but we're probably going to take him back to Ascot just before Christmas for the big 2m handicap he won three years ago. Although he's seven, he retains plenty of ability and seems to have got sharper. He stays well on the Flat but I don't think he gets 2m4f over hurdles - jumping seems to light him up and he almost travels too well. 07-11-24

runners.name: Heathen
runners.comment: Prevailed in a steadily-run 1m6f race last time; hasn't excelled over 2m in the past
runners.spotlight: Has only won on Tapeta and had the best turn of foot in a steadily-run race last time at Wolverhampton (1m6f); just a worry that he's not excelled over 2m in the past.

quotes.race: BetUK. It's Where The UK Bets Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
quotes.quote: I think two miles last time just stretched Heathen. He seems to be a horse who runs well fresh. He's quite delicate to handle and Dave [O'Meara, trainer] does a great job with horses like him. It all went smoothly, I was a bit worried about lack of pace but, even when the raced turned into a sprint, he could still travel into it well - Jason Watson, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

stable_tour.quote: He's the best-bred horse we have as he's by Lope De Vega out of an Irish Oaks winner. He's much better on the all-weather than turf. After the last all-weather season we put him away and we'll bring him back for a full all-weather campaign. He's back down to a good mark and tends to go well following a break, so first time out he'll be ready to go. David O'Meara thinks the break could have really benefited him and he could be one to follow through the winter. 26-09-24

runners.name: Tribal Star
runners.owner: Dooley Tbreds, J Fairhurst, Kabin Racing Synd, N Ohare

prev_owners.owner: Dooley T'breds, J Fairhurst, Kabin Racing Synd, N O'Hare

runners.comment: Can look as though he lacks concentration in a finish and he's unraced beyond 1m4f
runners.spotlight: Ex-Godolphin horse and paying his way for current connections; however, can look as though he lacks concentration in a finish and he's unraced beyond 1m4f; this race demands his best form yet.

runners.name: Humble Spark
runners.comment: Best form has been over shorter and didn't appear to stay 1m6f last time
runners.spotlight: Had a good winter on the AW but from 1m2f to 1m4f and didn't appear to stay 1m6f at Southwell last time; entered in the 4.07 on this card.

runners.name: Midnight Lion
runners.comment: Excellent record here; last win was at 1m2f but hasn't had many goes over this far
runners.spotlight: Enhanced his excellent record here with an all-the-way 2l success over 1m2f 20 days ago, under Lauren Young claiming the 7lb; his form at 2m leaves a bit to be desired but from fairly limited evidence, and horses from this yard are renowned for their versatility trip-wise.

quotes.race: Gamble Responsibly At BetUK Handicap
quotes.quote: Midnight Lion loves it round here and is thriving at the minute. He's very straightforward - he wings the gates, he doesn't pull in front and when you get stuck into him he really keeps finding - Paul Mulrennan, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Extra Winnings With BetUK Acca Club Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: We were hoping Midnight Lion would run like that as Paul [Mulrennan, jockey] had won on him over the course and distance. He developed a sinus problem and he's been on antibiotics so we were a bit negative about his chances. Fortunately he won, but he probably needs a tooth out, so it was quite impressive - Jim Goldie, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He won at Newcastle in April and we gave him a second run over hurdles at Huntingdon but he needs top of the ground and the rain got in there and spoiled his chance. He got a knock there but he's back on the go. He's probably more effective on the Flat, at 1m2f or 1m4f. 26-07-24

runners.name: Circuit Breaker
runners.comment: Has finished behind some of today's opposition in his last two races; up against it
runners.spotlight: Failed to kick on over hurdles and has finished behind some of today's opposition in his last two races; up against it.

quotes.race: Try Unibet's Improved Bet Builder Handicap (London Stayers' Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Circuit Breaker had a really tough trip at Hamilton last time and it was all too much for him. I had to leave him alone after that and, with the size of his feet, he wants a bit of juice in the ground. He might be one for the final of this series and I'm glad I've got him back on track - Ralph Beckett, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: It was a funny race with just four runners that he won at Kempton, but we always expected him to come on for that run. He's an out-and-out stayer and maybe something like the River Don in the spring might be an option. He cost plenty from the Flat but jumped well at Kempton and should continue to improve. 06-11-24

runners.name: King Chaos
runners.comment: Has stamina to prove over this far and being 2lb out of the weights won't help
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced ex-Karl Burke horse; odds-on when winning a 1m3f novice on the Southwell AW and performed below market expectations on handicap debut here (1m2f); has stamina to prove over this far and being 2lb out of the weights won't help.

runners.name: Wonder
runners.comment: Early days as a stayer and improving, but he's 4lb wrong here
runners.spotlight: His first run over 2m when making heavy weather of beating two rivals at Southwell and probably achieved more back there in defeat three weeks ago; should have more to offer as a stayer but he's 4lb wrong here.

runners.name: Weddell Sea
runners.comment: Seeks a hat-trick after narrow wins in two Class 5s over C&D; 8lb out of the weights
runners.spotlight: Took a while to win on the Flat but now seeks a hat-trick after narrow wins in two Class 5s over C&D; he's in a lot deeper here and 8lb out of the weights.

runners.name: Chillhi
runners.comment: Has been struggling for a while under both codes and he's 15lb out of the weights
runners.spotlight: Has been struggling for a while under both codes and he's 15lb out of the weights.

stable_tour.quote: A nice horse who had kissing spines and has been operated on. There were a few times last year when he went to win his races and his head came up. We were wondering whether he was thinking about the game, but we found out he had severe back problems. He's back in now and working away well and should be ready to run in a month. We think a lot of him and I reckon he could be all right. 03-04-24

4:07.race_name: BetUK All-Weather Easter Classic Middle Distance Handicap (GBBPlus Race)

runners.name: Savvy Victory
runners.comment: Narrow success over C&D in most recent AW attempt; this looks a stiffer task
runners.spotlight: Useful performer, albeit has an underwhelming strike-rate; narrowly beat Dark Moon Rising over C&D (off 3lb lower) in most recent AW attempt but this looks a stiffer task.

quotes.race: Davies Insurance Solutions Gala Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: We were absolutely gutted in the Wolferton. Savvy Victory got knocked over at a crucial time. We had an option of coming here or going for the John Smith's Cup and we chose to come here. We got away with it to be honest as that ground is drying out all the time. We took our time, and came there, and he has quickened on ground he doesn't really like as he would like it heavier. A mile and a quarter is his trip. You haven't seen anything yet. On heavy ground, he will be a proper horse - Sean Woods, trainer.

quotes.race: William Hill Handicap
quotes.quote: Things probably didn't go Savvy Victory's way last time, but he's done things the right way today and got a nice lead into the race. I might have got there too soon, but he's a lovely, progressive type - I'm sure he'll improve again from today. I was surprised how well he made up ground quickly and I suppose he could try a mile and a half again, although he'd have options at a mile and a quarter. I don't see why he couldn't step back into Listed company, although his best form is probably with cut in the ground. He's a heavy horse, but he might progress with regard to better ground with age - David Probert, rider.

runners.name: Hooking
runners.comment: Prolific French performer; creditable third off this mark in this race last year
runners.spotlight: Prolific French performer whose record of 8-18 on AW includes several Listed wins, the most recent in January; creditable third off this mark in this race last year; fighting chance.

runners.name: Paradias
runners.comment: Held off career-high mark last time; others are likely to prove better treated
