runners.spotlight: Has form figures of 3115 since switched to AW; held off career-high mark in the Rosebery at Kempton (1m3f) most recently and others are likely to prove better treated.

quotes.race: Free Bets With BetUK Bet Club Handicap
quotes.quote: We're not going to give hurdles another go at the moment. There are two pretty valuable mile-and-a-half handicaps coming up, the first of which is in about a month's time, so we'll look at those. It was a lovely performance. I'm delighted with Paradias and I don't know why he's not run on the all-weather until recently, but we tested the waters last time and that was strong form, so we thought we'd roll the dice again. He's not been over raced and he's learning to relax better. The step up in trip has helped him too - Alan King, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He had a good summer on the Flat, winning at Goodwood and finishing second at Epsom, and has a very workable mark back over hurdles so could be interesting. He won't want any further than two miles and he'll handle good to soft ground but not heavy. 25-10-24

He could be interesting in handicap hurdles. He had a good summer on the Flat, winning at Goodwood and finishing second at Epsom, and has a very workable mark. He won't want any further than 2m and he'll handle good to soft ground but not heavy. 07-11-24

runners.name: Charlottes Web
runners.comment: Good effort in the trial for this contest, taking AW record to 311112; big player
runners.spotlight: Record of 311112 on AW includes a success in the Winter Oaks at Lingfield; ran well there last time in the trial for this contest; progressive and has won over C&D; strong contender.

quotes.race: BetMGM Winter Oaks Fillies' Handicap (GBBPLUS Race)
quotes.quote: Jack [Mitchell gave Charlotte's Web a great ride from where she was drawn and she was relaxed in front. It's great that we've now won it three times and the plan now is for her to go to All Weather finals day at Newcastle - Simon Crisford, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: BetMGM Winter Oaks Trial Fillies' Handicap
quotes.quote: It was another step forward for Charlotte's Web and we're very much looking forward to seeing her back for the Winter Oaks. It's too early to compare her to our previous winners because she's still improving. I hope there's more to come from her, and there will need to be to win next time, but I couldn't be more pleased with her attitude and how she finished her race. Her jockey gave her a very nice ride - Simon Crisford, joint-trainer.

runners.name: Old Harrovian
runners.comment: Breezed clear for an easy win over C&D when last seen, taking AW record to 3-6
runners.spotlight: Cruised into contention and breezed clear for an easy win over C&D in January when last seen, taking AW record to 3-6 and looking a suitable type for this prize; could well defy a 9lb rise.

runners.name: Glen Buck
runners.comment: Improving; won going away at Southwell last time, taking record to 4-5; respected
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 6yo who won going away at Southwell (1m4f) most recently; taking record to 4-5; beat Old Harrovian there (1m3f) the time before; improving and commands respect.

stable_tour.quote: He needs time between his races and is quite delicate but he's a lovely horse who will more than likely go to Newcastle on Good Friday for the Easter Classic. I think he'll cope with coming back to ten furlongs and that race should really suit him. 11-04-25

runners.name: Penzance
runners.comment: Good second off 1lb higher in this contest 12 months ago; again likely to go well
runners.spotlight: Good second off 1lb higher in this contest 12 months ago when bidding for a five-timer; again likely to go well, having regained the winning thread at Chelmsford (1m2f) most recently.

stable_tour.quote: He's been one of our big success stories over the last 12 months. We bought him when he was rated 74 and he won four of his first five starts for us and went up to a career-high mark of 100 by the end of the all-weather season. It took him a while to get into gear on the turf but he ran his best race yet on the grass at Doncaster this month. That showed us he can compete in good races on the turf as well. He's going to go for the Cambridgeshire on Saturday. He's in good form and hasn't had a busy summer and it's brilliant prize-money and a fantastic race to have a runner in. It's a bit of a free hit. Away from that, he'll be working back from the Easter Classic, in which he was second last season. We'll be looking at some of the better all-weather prizes that will get him qualified for finals day. Hopefully he can go one better this time. 26-09-24

runners.name: Claymore
runners.comment: Balance of recent form suggests he can be opposed in this hot handicap
runners.spotlight: Losing spell goes back to his Royal Ascot success in 2022; well treated on peak figures but balance of recent form suggests he can be opposed in this hot handicap.

quotes.race: Hampton Court Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: Claymore has always been a proper horse. I think he improved in his trial and last time was just an absolute disaster. The only positive to come out of it was it probably made a man out of him, because his attitude today was brilliant. It was a first-class performance - Adam Kirby, jockey.

quotes.race: bet365 Craven Stakes (Group 3) (Colts & Geldings)
quotes.quote: That was a great run from a maiden winner and it was no disgrace to be beaten by last year's champion two-year-old. Claymore is French-bred so I think the plan would be to head to the French 2,000 Guineas as he will get all the premiums - Hugo Lascelles, racing manager to owner Mary Slack.

runners.name: Smart Hero
runners.comment: 2-2 this year, both wins at Wolverhampton; plenty in hand last time; interesting
runners.spotlight: Two from two since upped in distance, both wins at Wolverhampton (8.5f/9.5f); had plenty in hand last time and should cope with 9lb rise; interesting with further progress plausible.

runners.name: Salamanca
runners.comment: Still lightly raced and may improve on Chelmsford reappearance effort
runners.spotlight: Seems held by Penzance on Chelmsford running last month but is still lightly raced and may improve on that reappearance effort; unexposed colt who can't be dismissed.

runners.name: Power Of Destiny
runners.comment: Close third to Charlotte's Web in the Winter Oaks; still unexposed on AW
runners.spotlight: Useful filly whose handicap form for new yard comprises a win at Kempton (1m3f) and close third to Charlotte's Web in the Winter Oaks (1m2f); still unexposed on AW.

runners.name: Dark Moon Rising
runners.comment: No match for Old Harrovian when last seen; unlikely to reverse the placings
runners.spotlight: In good form since returned to AW but was among the beaten runners who proved no match for Old Harrovian in C&D event when last seen; unlikely to reverse the placings.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Club Handicap
quotes.quote: Dark Moon Rising is a talented horse when he's on a good day. He was very well handicapped on his old form. I don't know what was up with him, he hasn't been performing. But he travelled really strongly and galloped all the way to the line. He won cosily - Shane Gray, rider, talking to ITV.

quotes.race: Pure Broadband EBF Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Dark Moon Rising is a work in progress, he was very green first time. I thought he'd be a bit wiser today but he was green again. But once he passed one he picked the bridle up and he travelled well into the race. He came good from two down, he knuckled down and galloped through the line well. He'll keep improving with racing. He's a big, laid back horse at home, he's just going to have to learn with racing - Kevin Ryan, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He had some high-class form at three and if he can revert to the form he showed in the Dante he's on a very fair mark and could be a nice horse for handicaps. I think ten furlongs is his best trip and he'll benefit from getting back on a conventional track after not handling Pontefract last time. We retain a lot of faith in him. 03-05-23

runners.name: Andaleep
runners.comment: Current mark gives him a difficult task in this field
runners.spotlight: Has some useful form on AW but still has a better strike-rate on turf and current mark gives him a difficult task in this warm field.

quotes.race: BetUK. Home Of The Acca-Fenwa Handicap
quotes.quote: Andaleep was a pleasure to ride. The idea was to sit handy and tough it out, and he was a very game performer - Callum Hutchinson, jockey.

quotes.race: Imber Court Handicap
quotes.quote: I thought a mile and a half would be his trip but I was wrong! Andaleep likes proper quick ground and a mile and a quarter suits him really well. We'll look for another similar race on a stiff track - Graeme McPherson, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: When he was sent to us, we thought he'd win a couple because he was well handicapped, but not eight! He just keeps finding more, but this winter I think we've learned more too. Before, he was bullying lesser horses, but he's now at a level where we've had to work out exactly how to ride him, while there's a style of race that suits. He likes to come through horses, but seems suited to 1m2f and 1m4f races, where they don't go hard and it's a sprint. I think that's why he did well on the all-weather over the winter because they seem to walk in plenty of those races. He's won of turf, though, and should be out again in May. 02-05-24

runners.name: Dream Harder
runners.comment: Exposed sort who is unlikely to land this big pot
runners.spotlight: Held in races won by some of these rivals over the winter; most of that form is respectable but he's unlikely to land this big pot; exposed.

runners.name: Valiant Force
runners.owner: Amo Racing Limited & Giselle De Aguiar

prev_owners.owner: Amo Racing/Mrs R O'Callaghan/G De Aguiar
Amo Racing/Mrs R O'Callaghan/G De Aguiar

runners.comment: Irish colt who scored comfortably upped to 1m at Dundalk last time; unexposed at the trip
runners.spotlight: Irish colt who scored at Royal Ascot as a 2yo; comfortably justified favouritism over 1m at Dundalk most recently (raced at sprint trips previously) and is unexposed over this distance; possibilities.

quotes.race: William Hill Proper Betting Race
quotes.quote: The drop in class has probably done Valiant Force's confidence the world of good more than anything. I kind of kidded him along rather than being aggressive because he hasn't really been finishing his races. He disappointed on dirt in the States early this year but hopefully he's getting back on track now - David Egan, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: Norfolk Stakes (Group 2)
quotes.quote: To be fair to the lads, they were confident Valiant Force would run a big race. If you took away his last run at the Curragh, when he was on his own, he ran a stormer first time up in a Listed race, that's how much they thought of him. He's bred well, he's bred to be a sprinter, and he's something else to look at. He jumped well, did everything right. When I took the lead inside the two I was always in a rhythm and I probably could have won further if someone had come at me with a run. But he got the job done - Rossa Ryan, jockey, speaking to ITV.

runners.name: Symbol Of Light
runners.comment: Back in winning form the last twice, looking better than ever; not ruled out
runners.spotlight: Belatedly back in winning form the last twice, readily beating Cracking Gold at Southwell (1m) then holding on narrowly in notable handicap at Wolverhampton (8.5f); looks better than ever.

quotes.race: BetMGM Lincoln Trial Handicap
quotes.quote: We've had a runner in this race nearly every year, including when winning it with Big Country [2018], who also came from stall ten, just as Symbol Of Light has - Chris Dixon, owner's representative.

stable_tour.quote: He's new to us - we were alerted to the opportunity to buy him to stay in the Julie Camacho yard. He's a lightly raced five-year-old with an exceptional record on the all-weather. He's on a rating he's shown he can be competitive off and he's going to be aimed at the big pots on the all-weather. He'll be ready in the next few weeks and we'll work back from the mile race on all-weather finals day. 26-09-24

runners.name: Roi De France
runners.comment: Still open to further improvement and this step back up to 1m looks a plus; interesting
runners.spotlight: Successful twice and Listed placed over 1m last term; still open to further improvement and looks interesting returned to this distance with 7f reappearance (one place behind Local Hero) under his belt.

runners.name: Kingdom Come

prev_owners.owner: China Horse Club Int Ltd & Gandharvi UK

runners.comment: Went close off this mark in this contest last year; fighting chance
runners.spotlight: Ran creditably behind Symbol Of Light at Wolverhampton on reappearance when bidding for a second win in the Lincoln Trial; went close off this mark in this contest last year; fighting chance.

stable_tour.quote: We explored a mile at Newbury last time, but will come back to seven furlongs for the Buckingham Palace. I still think he's a very nice, progressive horse. 13-06-23

He had a productive start to the year completing a hat-trick in 7f contests, all at Kempton, the last two in handicaps. His only poor subsequent run was at Royal Ascot in the Buckingham Palace Stakes, but he ran a much more encouraging race when third at Haydock last time out. He looked as if a return to a mile would be helpful. I'm full of confidence that he will stay the trip with his pedigree. 02-08-23

runners.name: Popmaster
runners.comment: Ties in with Roi De France but remains far more exposed than that rival
runners.spotlight: Ties in with Roi De France on Kempton running last November (1m) and last month (7f); however, remains much more exposed than that rival and is still seeking first win at this trip.

quotes.race: Howden Challenge Cup (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: Tom Marquand just thought Popmaster had a little look at the other horse and it's so unfair [to be beaten in a photo]. He's running out of his skin at the moment and he's a great servant. If he doesn't run on Champions Day I think we'll put him away for the season but I'll have to speak to Ed Walker - Laurence Bellman, owner.

quotes.race: Wokingham Stakes (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: I've been second in so many big handicaps, an Ayr Gold Cup with Great Ambassador and we were second in the Kensington Palace here this week, and second in a Stewards' Cup. It's so frustrating, but they're so hard to win. Popmaster was spot on for today and I remember saying to Laurence (Bellman, owner) at Chelmsford when we were beaten and so disappointed that might have just won us a Wokingham - because it got his confidence back and we didn't have a penalty. It looked like we had a good draw and Tom gave him a peach of a ride, but we've Ryan Moore to blame! We'll go for all the big sprint handicaps and we hope he's got one in him - Ed Walker, trainer.

quotes.race: Fever-Tree Handicap
quotes.quote: We think Popmaster will be better next year and he's a good fun sprinter, who has been a bit unlucky this year - Laurence Bellman, owner.

stable_tour.quote: We're aiming high with him this season and I think he ran well in the Hungerford. We won't see him at his best until it's soft and with some cut in the ground at Doncaster, I wouldn't be surprised to see him run a huge race in the Park Stakes. 11-09-24
He's been running really well on the all- weather through the winter and has come down to a fair mark. We'll probably run him one more time then give him a break. He wants 7f to 1m. 16-04-25

runners.name: Destructive
runners.breeder: Allen Poindexter & More Than Ready Syn
runners.comment: 3-3 since being gelded, most recently winning the trial for this race; strong claims
runners.spotlight: Low-mileage 4yo who is 3-3 since being gelded (maiden previously), most recently winning with something to spare at Lingfield (1m) in the trial for this race; on a roll and holds strong claims.

runners.name: Apiarist
runners.comment: Did well on AW this winter and the form is solid; could have more to offer
runners.spotlight: Produced a strike-rate of 3-5 switched to AW this winter and the form is solid; came up short in the Lincoln most recently but could have more to offer back in this sphere; has won over C&D.

quotes.race: Win Â£1M With BetMGM's Golden Goals Handicap
quotes.quote: We've always liked Apiarist and he's thriving. He's picked up a couple of nice prizes and he's progressive. He's maturing with every run and the drop back to seven furlongs today suited him as he's raced keenly in the past. I thought Rab Havlin gave him a fantastic ride. He settled nicely and he has the stamina to stay out this trip. I think he won nicely in the end. This opens up options moving forward for him. The Lincoln could be the starting place for his turf season and those big handicaps are run at a good gallop, so they should suit him - Adam Ryan, trainer's assistant.

quotes.race: British EBF Â£100,000 Final (Colts & Geldings)
quotes.quote: We've always liked Apiarist. Last time he went too quick and we took our time today. He's a big, raw horse and he's going to be a lovely three-year-old. He could be a very progressive horse - Kevin Ryan, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's a lovely big horse and anything he did last year was a bonus. He's grown again through the winter but has really strengthened up. I might start him off in a 7f conditions race at the Craven meeting, just in case he runs a bit fresh, and then step him up to a mile. I'm sure there are going to be some big days with him. 04-04-24

runners.name: Brewing
runners.comment: Has done his winning over 6f/7f; something to prove back over 1m
runners.spotlight: Record of 6-13 on AW but gained the wins over 6f/7f; disappointing favourite last time when bidding for a Newcastle double and has something to prove back at 1m (second attempt).

quotes.race: Try Unibet's New Acca Boosts Handicap
quotes.quote: It looked as though there'd be a good bit of pace on and it worked out that way. Going back up to 7f at a track he's won at before probably all helped but I think Brewing is a horse who is really learning how to drop into gear now, he's been winning but has still looking a bit immature about it but tonight he was direct and true. It was a good performance - Tom Marquand, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Storm Star
runners.comment: Solid operator who completed a C&D double in January, taking Newcastle record to 3-4
runners.spotlight: Solid operator who completed a useful C&D double in January, beating several of these rivals and taking AW record to 3-6 (he's 3-4 at Newcastle); commands respect with further progress plausible.

quotes.race: BetMGM: It's Showtime Handicap
quotes.quote: Storm Star is a strong traveller, but he tends to hit a flat spot mid-race, whereas today he just took me into it without me feeling like I was ever going to get beaten on him - I struggled to pull him up as well! Once he's in this form, I don't think the track makes a difference, he'd have won wherever to be honest. It's nice to have a winner for Andrew [Balding, trainer] and Mr Smith [owner] - Hayley Turner, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Fantastic Fox
runners.comment: Finished third off 2lb higher in this event 12 months ago; each-way hopes
runners.spotlight: Met trouble in the Lincoln last time; ran creditably in races won by Storm Star and Destructive otherwise this year, and finished third off 2lb higher in this event 12 months ago; each-way hopes.

quotes.race: BetMGM - Stay Golden With Responsible Play Handicap
quotes.quote: It's always a bit worrying when you've let one go. You're hoping that you'll keep tabs with him but I think we went a decent gallop in our pack in trying to not let the leader get too far away. It's played out and worked in our favour. Fantastic Fox won quite cosily in the end - Aidan Keeley, rider.

quotes.race: MansionBet Bet Â£10 Get Â£20 Handicap (London Mile Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: I don't think it is Fantastic Fox's favourite ground, but his class got him through. He's still learning, he's a bit of a boy and is very babyish, and the day he grows up he'll be a nice horse - Silvestre de Sousa, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: A consistent horse who will go to Newcastle on Good Friday for the mile. He got knocked sideways from the word go in the Lincoln but he didn't have a hard race. He was third in the same race at Newcastle last year and, with a good draw and the right set-up, could run very well in it again. 11-04-25

A most genuine and likeable colt who won for the second time this year when taking a Haydock handicap this month. It was a memorable day for his owners as Leicester City also won the Community Shield at Wembley. It was also a memorable weekend for the yard as we had six winners from as many runners. Although the ground was very testing that day he seems to be effective in any conditions - it was just that he handled the soft conditions better than his rivals. He's a lovely colt going forward and we'll stick to handicaps for the time being, but ultimately I think he'll evolve into a Cup horse. 18-08-21

runners.name: Cracking Gold
runners.comment: Record of 112231 on AW; had wind surgery prior to Southwell win last time; solid
runners.spotlight: Has form figures of 112231 on AW; had wind surgery prior to justifying favouritism at Southwell (1m) most recently, posting a career-best performance; tongue-tie now added; solid claims.

runners.name: Exquisite Acclaim
runners.owner: Thomas J Oconnor & Ms Hazel Mcguinness
runners.comment: Irish gelding who is 2-3 in Dundalk contests this year; stiffer task in this field
runners.spotlight: Irish gelding who is 2-3 in Dundalk contests this year and beat Final Voyage over 1m most recently, belying 20-1 odds; stiffer assignment in this field and has never defied a mark this high.

quotes.race: Group Deals Available At Dundalk Stadium Rated Race
quotes.quote: Exquisite Acclaim travelled everywhere, was half-idling with me up the straight and I brought him over towards the rail. Once he did that he ran through the line well - Jamie Powell, jockey.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Acca Freeze Handicap
quotes.quote: Exquisite Acclaim has come back down now and he has got confidence. He's tough and he's hardy, and he's really putting his head down. He has a bit of class to him - Ado McGuinness, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish EBF Median Sires Series Maiden (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Exquisite Acclaim was good. He was giving weight to all rivals and still picked them up well. We've always held him in high regard at home and didn't think he'd have to wait until now to win his maiden, but he could be a nice progressive three-year-old next year - Shane Foley, rider.

stable_tour.quote: I was very pleased with him when fourth in the 2,000 Guineas Trial at Leopardstown. He might not be a top horse but is going the right way and could well be a nice Listed type. 14-04-22

runners.name: Final Voyage
runners.comment: Won the Vase Mile in 2023 but he's 5lb higher in this bigger prize; headgear fitted
runners.spotlight: Won the Vase Mile at Lingfield on Good Friday in 2023; he's 5lb higher in this bigger prize and has scored only once in the interim; chance depends on how well he responds to first-time headgear.

stable_tour.quote: This colt is so genuine and has given everyone a lot of fun with five wins from nine starts, which reads even better on the all-weather having a five from seven record. He does not go well on the grass so we will continue to race him on the artificial surface. He has risen through the ranks where he now finds himself with a rating of 93. There is a race at Wolverhampton on May 18 while there is a 1m2f option at Lingfield in mid-June. I would love to try him over 1m2f soon as I feel the extra trip could bring out improvement in him and add to his already commendable winning record. 28-04-21

runners.name: Nikovo

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late K Abdullah

runners.comment: Return to Newcastle looks a plus but this is a tough assignment
runners.spotlight: Record for current yard features two wins (in lower grades) at Newcastle, and the return to this venue looks a plus; however, faces a tougher task off career-high mark at this level.

2:25.race_name: BetMGM Fillies' And Mares' Championships Handicap

runners.name: Cloud Cover
runners.comment: Useful mare; record of 7-15 on AW includes a success in this race last year; respected
runners.spotlight: Useful mare whose record of 7-15 on AW includes wins in this race 12 months ago and Listed/handicap events at Deauville/Newcastle this winter; had wind surgery since last run; respected.

quotes.race: BetMGM Fillies' And Mares' Championships Handicap
quotes.quote: I said to Cliff just before the race that I was dying for a jockey to give me a heart attack, to come so late I nearly have to go into A & E afterwards and he executed it perfectly with a peach of a ride. He gave Cloud Cover the best ride she's had. The hood also helped, the straight seven furlongs was more of a stamina test so it was crucial she settled. For a filly with her sort of rating you want black type and there's a mile fillies' Listed race at Kempton next Saturday, but that will probably come a bit soon - James Tate, trainer.

quotes.race: Unibet More Extra Place Races Fillies' Handicap
quotes.quote: We went pretty steady which was my only worry, but I think Cloud Cover was just beaten by a good filly the last day. She was entitled to do what she did today and she's going the right way. James had her spot on and it was the perfect race for her. She could possibly be better in a better race. She's a good, strong-travelling filly even when they go a gallop. All she can do is keep improving - Rossa Ryan, jockey, speaking on Racing TV.

quotes.race: At The Races App Form Study Fillies' Handicap
quotes.quote: Cloud Cover is a filly we've liked for a while, but she's just taken her time to get to know what to do. She was a little bit green but fortunately she got her head down on the line. I'd be disappointed if there isn't more to come from her as she's a lengthy, scopey filly - James Tate, trainer.

runners.name: Aramis Grey
runners.comment: Consistent sort; ran well on this card two years ago; fighting chance off current mark
runners.spotlight: On a long losing sequence but is a consistent sort, latterly for new stable, and has a fighting chance off current mark; she's an eight-time AW scorer and ran well on this card two years ago.

runners.name: Powdering
runners.comment: In-form 5yo; looked as good as ever the last twice; likely to be thereabouts
runners.spotlight: In-form 5yo who scored at Southwell (7f/6f) in February/March and ran creditably at Wolverhampton most recently; looked as good as ever the last twice and is likely to be thereabouts.

runners.name: Gaiety Musical
runners.comment: Badly in under a penalty for Southwell win and is 0-9 over trips short of 1m
runners.spotlight: Recorded a neck win at Southwell 12 days ago, taking record at about 1m to 4-8; she's 0-9 over shorter trips and badly in under a penalty (future mark 3lb lower); not the percentage call.

runners.name: Shallow
runners.breeder: Hellwood Stud Farm & G P Clarke
runners.comment: Respectable strike-rate over 6f; doesn't appear to be crying out for this new trip
runners.spotlight: Front-running filly who has a respectable strike-rate over 6f and ran creditably last time when bidding for a Kempton hat-trick; remains in good form but doesn't appear to be crying out for this new trip.

quotes.race: Racing Welfare Restricted Maiden Fillies' Stakes (For horses In Bands B, C And D) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We jumped a little bit awkward, I think we got a bit of a bump, but we got to the front quite easy. Shallow was looking at everything and we got a nice easy lead. When I asked her to quicken, she did it really nicely - Darragh Keenan, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Viennoise
runners.comment: Encouraging form figures (432) for new yard; possibilities if taking well to headgear
runners.spotlight: Still has low mileage; 7f AW winner for previous yard; steady improvement (form figures 432) this year for new stable, only a neck behind Gaiety Musical at Southwell (1m) most recently; possibilities if taking well to first-time headgear.

runners.name: Quandary
runners.comment: Beat some of these rivals at Lingfield in the trial for this race; solid contender
runners.spotlight: Beat some of these rivals at Lingfield (7f) seven weeks ago in the trial for this race, taking form figures this year to 2321; Warren Fentiman's useful claim offsets being effectively 5lb higher; placed in both C&D attempts; solid chance.

stable_tour.quote: She never ran as a juvenile but has pleased me this spring and, having run a couple of fair races over 6f and 7f, I thought she had enough speed to try dropping her to the minimum trip last weekend. The 5f at Pontefract suited her perfectly and she travelled like the winner for a long way before Callum Rodriguez asked her to go on and win her race. That will have done her confidence the world of good and clearly she's going the right way. 01-06-23

runners.name: Pasha
runners.comment: Has shown signs that there's an AW contest in her; debut for new stable
runners.spotlight: Turf winner who has shown signs that there's an AW contest in her; sold out of the Cole yard for 20,000gns since last run; steps up in grade but market support should be noted.

runners.name: Brazilian Rose
runners.comment: Has done well at Newcastle this year; form of latest effort looks strong; not ruled out
runners.spotlight: Behind some of these opponents in the trial at Lingfield but has done well at Newcastle otherwise this year and went close over C&D last time (winner gives the form a strong look); not ruled out.

runners.name: Callianassa
runners.comment: Has some good form but seems unlikely to win; still a longstanding maiden
runners.spotlight: Ties in with several of these rivals on two pieces of form this year, so can't be completely dismissed; however, remains a longstanding maiden and seems set for another supporting role.

runners.name: Delicacy
runners.comment: Far from solid on 2025 form and is well out of the weights
runners.spotlight: Off the mark in ordinary turf contest on final start for previous yard; far from solid on her AW form for new stable and is well out of weights in this higher grade.

quotes.race: AK Bets Best Price Premier League Fillies' Handicap
quotes.quote: Sean gave Delicacy a really sympathetic ride and said she was always in his hands and going well. She's in the sales and I suppose she'll still go as there isn't a race for her before then - Rolf Johnson, owners' representative.

runners.name: Biplane
runners.comment: Out of her depth at this level; well out of the weights
runners.spotlight: Thoroughly exposed 7yo who has done most of her racing in much lower grades and looks out of her depth at this level; well out of the weights and readily opposed.

runners.name: Too Much
runners.comment: Recent form includes a C&D win but this is a much tougher task
runners.spotlight: Recent form includes a C&D success (Class 5) but this is a much tougher assignment; long way out of the handicap and unlikely to threaten.

quotes.race: talkSPORT Powered By Fans Handicap
quotes.quote: Too Much has done it nicely and hopefully she can progress. I don't think she's going to be a superstar but she's honest and tries hard so hopefully we can get another couple of numbers out of her - PJ McDonald, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Heavenly Heather
runners.comment: Five-race maiden who appears to have no chance at this level
runners.spotlight: Five-race maiden who has modest RPRs and appears to have no chance from miles out of the weights in this field.

stable_tour.quote: She's a big, strong filly. Her dam won twice for Godolphin in 2018 and was rated 91 by the time she finished her career. She hasn't run yet but she'll be out at the back end of the season. 22-08-24

runners.name: Marshman
runners.owner: Nick Bradley Racing 2 & Mrs E Burke
runners.comment: String of good runs since gelding/wind ops, including C&D; can go well despite top weight
runners.spotlight: He has always had lots of ability and gelding/wind operations last summer have prompted improvement from him this year; C&D win in January was more convincing than the neck margin indicates and he backed that up with a comfortable Listed win at Lingfield in February; beaten under a penalty in Listed events twice since but it was 5f on the first occasion and he was checked in his run back on turf three weeks ago; it will take a mighty effort to defy a BHA mark of 110 but it's not out of the question.

quotes.race: William Hill Best Odds Guaranteed Cammidge Trophy Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Marshman was on and off the bridle all along, he was never travelling like he usually does. I'm sure there is more in the tank from him - Karl Burke, trainer.

quotes.race: BetUK Kachy Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Marshman has been gelded and the wind op has improved him a bit more. It feels like he can breathe a bit better in his races. We've got a long season ahead - it's not really started yet so there'll be plenty of races - and he'll probably go into a Group 3 at some point. He's beaten some really good horses and I'll be looking forward to him next time. There were a few question marks as it was a sharper six furlongs, but a quicker gallop was going to suit him. He's very fiery. Even though he's won over six furlongs at Newcastle he's performed today - Clifford Lee, jockey.

quotes.race: Weekly Â£5 Free Bet With BetUK Handicap
quotes.quote: We don't really have a long-term target but Marshman took well to the all-weather, so the six-furlong handicap on finals' day would be an obvious place to look. That was his first time on the surface, so we'd need to find two more runs. We can aim high with him. I hope that's not the highlight of the year for him and it's just the start - Nick Bradley of Nick Bradley Racing.

quotes.race: Al Basti Equiworld Dubai Gimcrack Stakes (Group 2) (Colts & Geldings) (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: They're two lovely colts and we've got a lot to look forward to with them. Maybe running seven days after last week may not have helped Marshman, he had a real good blow. Though he won very easily, he had a race. There's a little bit more to come from him, maybe ridden a little bit differently. Clifford said he's still a bit green when he's in front on his own - Karl Burke, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: Being gelded and having wind surgery last summer definitely helped him. He's been in really good form on the all-weather this winter and goes for the All-Weather finals day at Newcastle on Friday week. He was a bit wound up in the stalls at Doncaster and never travelled after that, so I don't think that was his true running. If he can stay calm at the start, I think he'll be competitive off top weight at Newcastle. 11-04-25

An exciting time of the year for our stable as last year's smart juveniles form part of the strongest team of three-year-olds I have had to train. Marshman did his bit last year winning the first starts before finding only Noble Style too good for him in the Gimcrack. He is a very fast horse who will stick to sprints this year and he showed his well being when taking the Group 3 Prix Sigy at Chantilly (5Â½f) a couple of weeks ago. That was a smart performance as I thought he would need the run first time out. He has come out of that well and the plan is the Sandy Lane Stakes, which we won last year with El Caballo. He also has the Commonwealth Cup as his first big target for the year. 07-05-23

runners.name: Diligent Harry
runners.comment: 2-3 over C&D, including this race in 2023; promising run at Southwell latest; new headgear
runners.spotlight: Won this race in 2023 when it was a conditions event; remains capable of high-class form on turf and AW and he ran his best race this year when third of 11 off this mark at Southwell 12 days ago; won't be far away with a repeat under conditions that suit him well; new blinkers replace usual cheekpieces.

quotes.race: 1895 Duke Of York Clipper Stakes (Group 2)
quotes.quote: We did our fight there, then the first and second came at us late in the day. I'm very proud of Diligent Harry, it was a big run. I'm very pleased and he's in a good place. I couldn't be more happier bar winning. We've got him in the King Charles III at Royal Ascot as a stiff five furlongs is more in our favour - Clive Cox, trainer.

quotes.race: BetUK Hever Sprint Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: We were worried about the drop back to the minimum [trip], but Clive thought there would be plenty of pace on which would suit Diligent Harry and he was right. There are plenty of options going forward after that - Martin Bosley, trainer's assistant.

quotes.race: BetUK All-Weather Sprint Championships Conditions Stakes
quotes.quote: It was a great ride. I'm looking forward to the summer with Diligent Harry, he's exciting. He's got a bit of confidence, gelding has helped him and he's matured - Clive Cox, trainer.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes 3 Year Old All-Weather Championships Conditions Stakes (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: We're a little bit away from that [Commonwealth Cup] at the moment but let's hope Diligent Harry takes a step forward. I still think he could be quite special - Adam Kirby, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Unibet New Instant Roulette Novice Stakes
quotes.quote: Diligent Harry is still a bit of a baby but he has some size about him and he should be a nice horse for the turf this summer - Clive Cox, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He ran well last week at Southwell when third under top weight, which was his best run of the year, and he now runs on All-Weather Championships finals day at Newcastle on Friday. He won at the meeting two years ago and I'm looking forward to running him. 17-04-25

It was great to see him back to near his best when second in the Group 3 Hackwood Stakes at Newbury. He had enjoyed a good campaign before that, having won twice at Newcastle, the latter being the All-Weather Sprint Championships. The form of that race is pretty hot as the runner-up, Witch Hunter, went on to win at Royal Ascot, while further down the field Vadream has gone on to win the Group 3 Palace House Stakes at Newmarket. He has yet to win on grass, but his head second to Commanche Falls last time, one of the most consistent horses in training, shows that there are big races to be won with him. I think the Hopeful Stakes at Newmarket is a possible logical step after that fine effort. At some point we will give him a break before preparing him for the next all-weather season. 02-08-23

runners.name: Willem Twee
runners.comment: Strong C&D form; capable off this mark & latest effort was eyecatching; now gets headgear
runners.spotlight: Capable of smart form on AW and better than ever last summer, third in the Group 3 Chipchase Stakes over C&D in June (strong form) before winning a Racing League handicap at Wolverhampton off this mark; rather lost his way after that but there were green shoots of recovery at Kempton three weeks ago (7f), finishing off strongly in a race that didn't set up favourably for those held up; interesting contender with cheekpieces now reached for.

quotes.race: BetUK Golden Rose Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Willem Twee is a lovely horse. It was quite a tactical race, the pace was slow and I elected to stay three deep but to keep cover. I probably delivered him into the race early enough. He's a very nice horse, he's got a future. He gave me a lovely feel as I started to improve into the race round the turn - Oisin Murphy, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Fivethousandtoone
runners.comment: Good C&D form, including easy win in this race last year; promise all starts for new yard
runners.spotlight: Picked up impressively when when winning this race 12 months ago off a 3lb lower mark; also ran a big race in a hot Group 3 here next time (closely matched with Willem Twee), taking his C&D record to 13214; left Andrew Balding prior to his return at Kempton in February and his three runs for his new stable have all been full of promise; hasn't had a huge amount of help from the handicapper as a consequence but Oisin Murphy is back in the saddle and a big run looks assured.

quotes.race: BetUK All-Weather Sprint Handicap
quotes.quote: Today it all came together and hopefully it will be the beginning of a decent season for Fivethousandtoone. He was good last time and better today - Oisin Murphy, jockey.

quotes.race: William Hill Best Odds Guaranteed Handicap
quotes.quote: Fivethousandtoone has run well without winning. The race worked out well for him today, waiting with him and coming late. That's his level - William Buick, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He was a very smart juvenile, winning over 6f before finishing second in the Mill Reef Stakes and mid-division over 7f in the Dewhurst Stakes. He had a setback earlier this year but that has been resolved and he is now back in fast work. The plan is to go straight to Royal Ascot for the Commonwealth Cup. He is a very smart horse who looks very together this year and is one I am excited about getting back on the track. 19-05-21

runners.name: Apache Outlaw
runners.owner: Dooley Thoroughbreds & J Fairhurst & Paul Riley

prev_owners.owner: Dooley Thoroughbreds & J Fairhurst & Paul Riley
Dooley Thoroughbreds & J Fairhurst & Paul Riley

runners.comment: Good record on AW in Ireland; perhaps a shade high in the weights for this though
runners.spotlight: Fine record on the AW track at Dundalk, winning four of his seven races there; poorly drawn when unplaced at Lingfield last Good Friday (when rated 6lb lower); surplus stamina no bad thing on his first visit here but he's 6lb higher than for his latest success and perhaps a shade high in the weights for a race of this nature.

quotes.race: Christmas Party Nights At Dundalk Stadium Handicap
quotes.quote: Apache Outlaw has improved plenty and is an out-and-out sprinter who enjoys a fast pace. We might come back for the all-weather finals at Newcastle - Ado McGuinness, trainer.

quotes.race: Fleetwood Paints Handicap
quotes.quote: Apache Outlaw was off a nice weight today. He travelled into the race today probably better than any of his runs over five or six, he was just on form today - Adam Caffrey, rider.

runners.name: Golden Mind
runners.comment: Exploited a soft lead at Kempton (6f) in February; less good over 7f since; headgear today
runners.spotlight: Won a competitive Kempton handicap (6f) in February from the front (tongue tied for the first time) but he was gifted a soft lead and they dawdled until halfway; less good over 7f twice since and others bring more pressing claims; blinkers now tried.

quotes.race: Free Bet With Unibet's Betbuilder Rebound Handicap (London Sprint Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: There didn't seem to be much pace so when Golden Mind broke well I was able to get across and went fairly steady, getting the race my own way to be honest, and he's quickened up and done it well in the end. He gets 7f and I could see him going up in trip again - Oisin Orr, jockey, talking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Saint Lawrence
runners.comment: Uninspiring form figures but almost certainly well handicapped & latest C&D run promising
runners.spotlight: Looked good when surging home in the 2023 Wokingham at Royal Ascot (stable debut) and he was beaten under one length in a French Group 1 on his next start; struggled for consistency since but there were flashes of retaining his ability last year; well held on first two AW runs this winter but his midfield finish behind Marshman over C&D in January was much more encouraging, poorly positioned and meeting trouble but finishing with running left in him; probably not straightforward but almost certainly well treated now.

quotes.race: Arc Prix Maurice de Gheest (Group 1) (3yo+) (Straight Course) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Saint Lawrence has run an absolute stormer and I think if the pace had been stronger, he'd have nearly won. He's definitely improving and he's proved himself at Group 1 level; he's taken a big step up from winning a handicap at Ascot - Hollie Doyle, jockey.

quotes.race: Wokingham Stakes (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: Saint Lawrence has always shown us plenty at home, he's a very nice horse to have around and I'm just delighted to get the job done on first time of asking. I fancied all three of them, I made sure Hollie chose which one to ride so it wasn't my fault and she chose right! - Archie Watson, trainer.

quotes.race: Betfair Palace House Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: It was probably trainer error as a two-year-old thinking as he is by Al Kazeem Saint Lawrence would be fine over seven furlongs. He is entered in the King's Stand. James (Doyle, jockey) said he can go five or six and we might look at the Leisure Stakes at Windsor which is an easy six in about two weeks' time - Roger Varian, trainer.

quotes.race: Denford Stakes (Listed Race) (Formerly The Washington Singer Stakes)
quotes.quote: Saint Lawrence has looked a nice one and was one of ours we nominated early on in the first week (to get in certain races). Although he's by Al Kazeem he'd shown up well in May on the gallops and we thought he could be a Chesham horse. He didn't go down that route, but wasn't disgraced in the Pat Eddery or Superlative, although those races probably didn't go his way. I'm not sure about plans. Andrea said he'd get a mile, but I don't think he necessarily has to next time. He's had five runs, so maybe one or two more this season and the Royal Lodge can favour experience. Now he's a Listed winner, we have to aim at Group 3s and Group 2s and there are no soft options so we'll see. He'll be better on better ground - Roger Varian, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He could run in the Abernant at the Craven meeting or we might wait for a valuable 6f handicap at the Guineas meeting. Although he's not a regular winner, his runs in the Palace House and King's Stand last season were really good. He's been gelded, which might help, and he could be a Wokingham horse. 06-04-23

He won at Listed level as a two-year-old and has progressed this season without adding to his two career wins. His best run was when second to Rohaan in the Pavilion Stakes at Ascot in April, which was a superb effort. I'm looking forward to campaigning him in the autumn and he should get his head in front again as he's pleasing us at home. 18-08-21

runners.name: We Never Stop
runners.comment: Done well on AW this winter, winning twice at Southwell; further progress required today
runners.spotlight: Prominent racer who has done well on AW this winter having been gelded and tried in headgear, winning twice over 6f at Southwell and also running well over C&D; 4lb higher than for his latest win and needs another step forward to take this.

quotes.race: Gamble Responsibly At BetUK Handicap
quotes.quote: Everything fell into place today really. We Never Stop jumped well, and they went a blistering gallop, so I just sat off the lead a little bit and it worked out really well. I had something to aim at going to the furlong pole, and he had a good look when he got there, but he's done it comfortably in the end - Shane Gray, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: The Caltonian
runners.owner: John Murphy & Miss L A Perratt
runners.comment: Admirably progressive sprinter who has conditions to suit; this looks a hot race though
runners.spotlight: He has made giant strides since blinkers went on, winning six AW handicaps including three over C&D; better than ever when seeing off We Never Stop and eight others here on New Year's Day; surprising if there weren't a few stronger in this field.

runners.name: Coachello
runners.breeder: Mrs M Leurson & Mrs C Head
runners.comment: Talented on his day and could outrun his odds granted a good pace to aim at
runners.spotlight: Appreciated the return to AW when getting up late to win a 6f handicap at Wolverhampton in late December; beaten three times since but there have been mitigating circumstances; a strong pace would suit him and he should go well at a big price.

quotes.race: Dubai Sprint Presented by Longines (Listed Race) (Turf)
quotes.quote: Coachello broke well and travelled strongly before really battling close home on ground he enjoyed - Pat Dobbs, jockey.

runners.name: Daamberdiplomat
runners.comment: Capable on AW & ran well after a short break last month; others look better treated though
runners.spotlight: Useful sprinter on AW, albeit not without some quirks; ended 2024 in fine form and he also ran well at Dundalk on his return from a three-month break last month; whether he's well-enough treated for a race of this nature remains to be seen (only fourth at Lingfield last Good Friday when rated 4lb lower).

quotes.race: Christmas Party Nights At Dundalk Stadium Handicap
quotes.quote: Six furlongs and coming off a good gallop on this surface really suits DAAMBERDIPLOMAT. He does get seven but a proper strongly-run six is ideal for him. He's good fresh so we liked his chance coming here this evening - Ben Coen, rider

quotes.race: Irish EBF Median Sires Series Maiden (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: I did not feel Daamberdiplomat had progressed at home but that was pretty impressive. He settled better dropping back in trip, I am not sure where we will go next but we will be in no rush. We might look at the Killavullan later in the year - Johnny Murtagh, trainer.

runners.name: Heathcliff
runners.breeder: Mr & Mrs P Hopper, Mr & Mrs M Morris
runners.comment: Conditions to suit; in far better form than his figures suggest; still has more to offer
runners.spotlight: Won a good race over C&D last summer and he's looked better than ever this year despite three defeats; needs a good pace at this trip but that would appear likely and unlike most in here, he hasn't yet reached his ceiling; one of two strong contenders for James Fanshawe.

runners.name: Run Boy Run
runners.comment: Done well since cheekpieces went on; good 2nd to Marshman over C&D in January; respected
runners.spotlight: He hasn't really looked back since cheekpieces went on and he ran a fine race when chasing home Marshman over C&D in January; relatively unexposed at 6f but he will need another career best.

quotes.race: BetUK. Home Of The Acca Restricted Maiden Stakes (For horses In Bands B, C And D) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Run Boy Run made very hard work of it. I wasn't overly keen on his attitude to be honest but I think some headgear will iron that out - Jason Hart, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Badri
runners.comment: As good as ever this winter, badly hampered when launching his challenge latest; contender
runners.spotlight: Looked better than ever when winning at Southwell (6f) in January; solid effort over 5f here next time and would surely have gone close to rewarding strong market support back at Southwell five weeks ago but for getting hampered against the rail over 1f out when launching his challenge; this is hot but he's dangerous off a low weight.

quotes.race: JRA Tokyo Trophy Handicap
quotes.quote: We were thinking Badri was just an all-weather horse. We ran him at Beverley as we thought a stiff five would suit. He romped home and he wasn't disgraced at York. It didn't look like he was coming down the hill but he was doing his best work where it mattered most. We tried him on the grass last year and he didn't really look like he suited it but my horses are running much better this year and that is sometimes how it goes. We were thinking about the Gosforth Park Cup as he's unbeaten over five furlongs at Newcastle, and there's also a big five-furlong handicap at Ascot in July - we had that in mind thinking that a stiff five at Ascot would suit him - Ruth Carr, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's a classy horse who is new to us having been acquired out of Ruth Carr's yard following four wins this year. He joins the yard with a rating of 100 and I must praise Ruth, who did a great job with him - I've been very pleased with him since he arrived. We're going to stick to what we know he does best and that is sprint handicaps. He ran in a 5f handicap at Newcastle last week, coming from off the pace to finish a highly creditable second. Looking ahead, there is the Portland Handicap and the 6f International Handicap at York we may consider. 06-09-23

1:50.race_name: BetMGM All-Weather 3 Year Old Championships Handicap

runners.name: So Darn Hot
runners.comment: Improving at 6f, well on top the last twice despite hanging left; can rate higher still
runners.spotlight: The winner of his last three runs over 6f (also ran well over 5f in November), including C&D in January and at Lingfield seven weeks ago; has hung left in the closing stages for both those victories but was well on top at the finish on each occasion; another 6lb rise to contend with but he's on the up and has to enter the reckoning.

quotes.race: BetMGM AWC 3 Year Old Trial Handicap
quotes.quote: We didn't expect So Darn Hot to win like that. He was essentially carrying 12lb more than last time and I wasn't sure Lingfield would suit him. He didn't have any cover, which wasn't ideal, but he's by Too Darn Hot and his progeny love a good fight - Kevin Philippart De Foy, trainer.

quotes.race: Livescore Bet Cock O'The North EBF Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: So Darn Hot has definitely sharpened up and was a bit cautious of the ground early on, but he's had no problem with that. He's very game and he felt the other horse come to him and found another gear. There'll be more to come next year. He's done really well over six months. He just wasn't there for his debut at Salisbury, but he's going from strength to strength - Benoit de la Sayette, jockey.

runners.name: Good Banter
runners.comment: Two 6f novice wins on AW as a 2yo; excuses for both handicap defeats this year; unexposed
runners.spotlight: Promising 2yo, winning a pair of 6f novice events at Wolverhampton; beaten favourite in two handicap runs this year, poorly drawn behind So Darn Hot at Lingfield and then looking stretched by 7f five weeks ago; has a bigger effort in him but this is competitive.

runners.name: Carbine Harvester
runners.comment: Flourished since handicapping in a tongue tie; 2lb wrong under penalty but should run well
runners.spotlight: Four wins and a second (behind So Darn Hot) since moving into handicaps with a tongue tie fitted, the latest success coming at Kempton (6f; made all) 11 days ago; 2lb wrong under his penalty but likely to give it another good go.

runners.name: Berkshire Whisper
runners.owner: Berkshire Parts & Panels Ltd No1 Fanclub
runners.comment: Unexposed colt who won easily here last month; doubt we've seen the best of him yet
runners.spotlight: Promising second to Megaphone on his Kempton debut in January and he's won both starts since, defying a penalty in fine style over C&D last month; that race was slowly run to halfway but he picked up strongly in the manner of one with plenty more to offer; needs to improve again to defy his opening mark but that would appear likely; stable, who have won the last two renewals, run three here.

runners.name: Dark Ace
runners.comment: Two 6f Dundalk wins as a 2yo; stiff task on return; improvement required on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Prominent racer who won twice at Dundalk (6f) in the latter part of 2024; faced a stiff task at Dundalk five weeks ago and dropped away in the straight; wouldn't look obviously well treated for his handicap debut.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Auction Maiden
quotes.quote: We probably actually expected that two runs ago on his first start as Dark Ace showed us plenty at home, but the first day he ran a bit free and things didn't go to plan. We worked him up here last week on the surface and he worked well - Adam Caffrey, jockey, talking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Hello Zaman
runners.comment: Lingfield win (6f) in January and ran well behind a useful 3yo last time; unexposed
runners.spotlight: Promise in all three runs this winter, winning at Lingfield in January (6f) and picked off late back there last month; had the run of that novice event but the winner has since finished fourth in the Greenham; should still have more to offer.

quotes.race: Extra Winnings With BetUK Acca Club Restricted Novice Stakes (Bands B, C And D) (GBB) (Div I)
quotes.quote: I've always liked Hello Zaman a lot. He had a few little babyish niggles as a two-year-old, which is why he didn't appear until December and he was very green on debut. Thankfully, he showed a bit more like what we think of him there. He was still a bit green, so I'd hope he can step forward again and be quite smart in time. I think he'll be a sprinter being by Hello Youmzain, his last furlong was his best, so I think six furlongs will be his trip - James Tate, trainer.

runners.name: Humam
runners.comment: Unexposed and improving 3yo; no real excuse at Southwell last time though; yard run three
runners.spotlight: 6lb better off with So Darn Hot on their Doncaster run in November; progressed on AW since, winning at Lingfield (7f) and Southwell (6f) before coming up just shy in his hat-trick bid five weeks ago; 1lb rise manageable; one of three runners for Andrew Balding.

runners.name: Marchogion
runners.comment: Behind two of these at Lingfield seven weeks ago; open to further progress; contender
runners.spotlight: Didn't need to improve to win a 6f Southwell novice in January; turned in an improved display when third behind So Darn Hot and Carbine Harvester at Lingfield seven weeks ago, making good late inroads having been poorly positioned turning for home; good claims of turning that form around with further progress expected.

runners.name: Don Pacifico
runners.comment: Easy Southwell win in December but finished behind Hello Zaman at Lingfield last month
runners.spotlight: Confirmed the promise of November's debut third to Good Banter when running away with a Southwell novice one month later; finished behind Zaman at Lingfield last month, however, and others are more appealing.

quotes.race: BetUK. It's Where The UK Bets EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race) (Div II)
quotes.quote: It was a lovely performance. Don Pacifico put that experience at Wolverhampton to good use and I was very comfortable once I got him relaxed and in a rhythm. He's still inexperienced and had a look around in the straight so hopefully there's more to come- Jack Mitchell, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Cyclonite
runners.comment: Two AW wins, including C&D, as a 2yo; placed behind reopposing rivals the last twice
runners.spotlight: Two AW wins as a 2yo, including C&D, and he has finished third behind reopposing rivals on his last two starts; a career best is required to overcome this mark.

quotes.race: JPS Ceilings And Partitions Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: I've always liked Cyclonite, but he's just taken a while to get going and learn the game. I think he's done it a bit easier than it looked, to be honest. He's a nice-looking colt and he's a May foal, so he's definitely one who will keep on improving. I did think he was ready to go and win earlier on in the season, but things just didn't go his way for whatever reason - James Ferguson, trainer.

runners.name: Megaphone
runners.owner: Exors Of The Late Adrian Mcalpine
runners.comment: Only third on recent handicap debut (5f); return to 6f can help but it needs to
runners.spotlight: Got the better of Berkshire Whisper at Kempton on January's stable debut (6f; well backed) and followed up at Wolverhampton in February (5f); slightly disappointing when third on his recent handicap debut (5f; first run after a gelding operation); return to 6f can help but others may be open to greater progress.

stable_tour.quote: He was a little disappointing at Wolverhampton but we'll see him up at six furlongs next time and he's one we're looking forward to on the turf. Before then, the All-Weather Finals day has a Â£150,000 handicap for three-year-olds that we might go for. 07-04-25

runners.name: Master Technician
runners.comment: Three 7f wins to his name; drops to 6f for the first time in a deep race; others stronger
runners.spotlight: Raced exclusively over further, winning three of his eight starts; gained first handicap success at Wolverhampton in February; 4lb rise not excessive but the drop in trip is a query, especially in a race as deep as this one.

stable_tour.quote: He's a nice two-year-old who came from the breeze-ups.  He could be a nice horse later on. He'd be my dark horse. 11-07-24

runners.name: Leadenhall Street
runners.comment: Only fifth at Southwell latest; too soon to write off further progress; considered
runners.spotlight: Well backed when bolting up on his handicap debut at Southwell (6f) in February; came up short back at that track five weeks ago but still improved his RPR; likely there's a bigger effort in him at some point.

runners.name: Tuco Salamanca
runners.comment: Three wins over further this year; drops back in trip with a tongue tie added
runners.spotlight: Had wind surgery in November and he's shown the benefit of it this year, winning a 7f maiden at Kempton in February and adding handicap wins at Wolverhampton (8.6f) and here (7f) in March; only fourth at Southwell 16 days ago and hopes rest on the tongue-tie and drop to 6f sparking another surge of improvement.

runners.name: Bowmark
runners.comment: Kingman colt who was impressive at Kempton in sole 2yo start; useful prospect
runners.spotlight: Kingman half-brother to two winners for his connections, out of a Listed scorer; scooted clear for an impressive win at Kempton (1m) in sole 2yo start and looks a useful prospect; interesting.

runners.name: Glittering Legend
runners.comment: Progressive gelding whose record is 3-5; his best sibling won this contest in 2021
runners.spotlight: Progressive gelding who took well to AW in Kempton conditions race (1m) on reappearance, adding to his 2yo turf wins and taking record to 3-5; his best sibling won this contest in 2021; respected.

runners.name: Michael Scofield
runners.comment: Irish-trained gelding who is 2-2, both wins at Southwell; promising type
runners.spotlight: Irish-trained gelding who has a US pedigree; two from two, both wins over 1m at Southwell; faces a stiffer task on bare figures upped in grade but is a promising type who could well rate higher.

quotes.race: Best Odds Guaranteed At BetMGM Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Michael Scofield knew his job you know, and I thought we went fairly even (gallop) throughout. He showed a nice turn of foot, and I think he's a horse that will probably get ten furlongs - Kieran Shoemark, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Nordic Norm
runners.comment: Solid promise in two C&D events; represents last year's winning yard
runners.spotlight: Solid promise in two C&D events, narrowly beating a subsequent scorer then running well under a penalty; plenty to find on ratings but represents last year's winning yard and may improve further.

stable_tour.quote: His form is working out well and we're aiming at the Listed Burradon Stakes on Good Friday. I thought we were going to be stepping up in trip but he seems to be getting faster with racing and I'm happy to stick at a mile for now. 11-04-25

runners.name: Royal Playwright
runners.comment: 2yo form featured good efforts in the Solario and the Royal Lodge; top on ratings
runners.spotlight: Won on debut then ran well in the Solario and the Royal Lodge; form dipped in the Futurity but this is a big drop back in grade; top on ratings and has an excellent chance provided he takes to AW.

runners.name: Titanium Emperor
runners.owner: Amo Racing Limited & Giselle De Aguiar
runners.comment: Successful debut in Dundalk race; nicely bred; open to any amount of improvement
runners.spotlight: Irish colt who cost 220,000gns as a yearling and has a smart pedigree; promising debut in Dundalk race (1m) six weeks ago, scoring by 3l; open to any amount of improvement and looks interesting.

2:05.race_name: BetUK All-Weather Vase Middle Distance Handicap (GBBPlus Race)

runners.name: Mr Baloo
runners.comment: A revelation on the AW this year (213111); much respected in his bid for the four-timer
runners.spotlight: Has proved a revelation on the AW this year (213111) with his wins coming over 7f-9.5f; failed to beat a rival in his only previous visit here (7f), but he is a completely different proposition now and is much respected in his bid for the four-timer; 4-7 under Joe Leavy.

runners.name: Kind Of Kiss
runners.owner: Crest Racing Vii & D A Olver
runners.comment: Third of 12 in an even warmer handicap than this over C&D seven weeks ago; major player
runners.spotlight: 1-3 on turf in France for Andre Fabre; didn't show much in his first two starts for this yard (1m, Tapeta), but much better when third of 12 in an even warmer handicap than this over C&D (80-1) seven weeks ago; three of those behind have won since so he is a major player from the same mark.

runners.name: Koy Koy
runners.comment: Has since undergone wind surgery since last seen; something to prove
runners.spotlight: In good form in two starts at Wolverhampton (9.5f, Tapeta) in November but ended the year on a low note, pulling up at Newcastle and failing to beat a rival back at Wolverhampton; has since undergone wind surgery and returns from four months off with something to prove.

quotes.race: Time Test Handicap
quotes.quote: Koy Koy put up a good performance all things considered. There was no pace on and I let him bowl along. He was very game at the finish - William Buick, rider.

quotes.race: Sir David Sieff EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race) (Div II)
quotes.quote: Koy Koy is a horse who is going to stay further. I just left him to go a good, even pace, which is why I think the winning distance is so far. We used his fitness and experience - Oisin Murphy, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He didn't handle the track at Epsom after travelling pretty well last time. He'll probably get in a Hunt Cup or a Buckingham Palace. He's still a little high in the weights to be competitive at the highest level for his grade so I'd probably be favouring the Buckingham Palace but he'll have an entry in both. 11-06-24

Joined us last summer after finishing mid-division in the Britannia. He won first time out for us at the July course over a mile on fast ground and ran well after. We had him gelded in the autumn and he has come back better than ever and goes to Royal Ascot in terrific form. The prime target is the Royal Hunt Cup if he gets in, but failing that we could run him in the Buckingham Palace Stakes. I could not be happier with him, but the only slight downside is I would not want it rattling fast, but he could be a very attractive each-way bet at a big price. 14-06-23

runners.name: Arcadian Nights
runners.comment: 2-4 over C&D and one for the shortlist up another 3lb in his bid for the four-timer
runners.spotlight: Best known for his Wolverhampton exploits (six wins) but is 2-4 over this C&D; 3-3 so far this year and one for the shortlist up another 3lb in his bid for the four-timer, despite an awkward draw.

quotes.race: Â£30 In Free Bets With BetUK Handicap (GBBPlus Race)
quotes.quote: Arcadian Nights has got form with a lot of the horses he was taking on. His only quirk is in the stalls and he was a bit slow getting out but he found the prominent rhythm and has a good turn of foot - Billy Loughnane, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Beraz
runners.breeder: S C H H The Aga Khan's Studs
runners.comment: Well handicapped on his best turf form, but is 0-7 on the AW and has the outside stall
runners.spotlight: Well handicapped on his best turf form and ran well when third of 11 behind a subsequent winner at Newcastle (1m2f, Tapeta) last time, but he is 0-7 on the AW and has the outside stall.

quotes.race: Kube - Leicester's Premier Event Hire Venue Handicap
quotes.quote: Beraz had been progressive prior to his last run and he's bounced back here. He's a grand, big horse and he was fine with the drop back to a mile and a quarter - Graham Lee, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He started his career with Alain de Royer-Dupre before having a couple of hurdle outings for Dan Skelton. He joined us in the spring and has done well, finishing second at Hamilton on his debut and then winning at the same venue seven weeks later over 1m4f. His last run, again at Hamilton, was disappointing and unfortunately nothing has come to light. We'll just put it down to an off day as he's clearly a lovely horse and with a rating of 88, he'll be competitive in some nice 1m4f handicaps when we get a bit of juice in the ground. Hopefully he'll get back on track this autumn. 06-09-23

runners.name: Silent Age
runners.comment: Close fourth behind Mr Baloo and Son Of Man at Wolverhampton last time; could play a part
runners.spotlight: 2-4 for Charlie Appleby and was off for 292 days before returning for this yard in February; beaten less than a length into fourth of ten behind Mr Baloo and Son Of Man at Wolverhampton (9.5f, Tapeta) last time and capable of playing a part; stable also runs Tribal Wisdom.

runners.name: Son Of Man
runners.comment: Only beaten half a length by Mr Baloo at Wolverhampton last time; should be thereabouts
runners.spotlight: 0-12 since his successful racecourse debut, but was beaten only half a length by Mr Baloo at Wolverhampton (9.5f, Tapeta) last time; 2lb better off and should be thereabouts if building on that performance.

runners.name: Rogue Encore
runners.comment: Dual Newcastle winner in November, but beaten three times off this mark since
runners.spotlight: Won his first two starts at Newcastle (1m, Tapeta) in November after the cheekpieces went on, but has been beaten three times off this mark since, the latest when fifth of 12 at Kempton (1m, Polytrack) 11 days ago; has stamina to prove and others look better treated.

stable_tour.quote: This colt has a nice pedigree and he looks to have ability to match. His training is going very well and the plan will be to start him off in the next month. His work has been good and he will be another for the 'Rogues' to look forward to. 06-07-23

runners.name: Lordsbridge Blu
runners.comment: Reportedly lame when behind three of these at Wolverhampton last month; bit to prove
runners.spotlight: Landed an uncompetitive Wolverhampton novice (9.5f, Tapeta) last September; reportedly finished lame when behind three of these on his return from 130 days off there last month; has a bit to prove.

runners.name: Cephalus
runners.comment: 10-24 on the AW with all wins coming over 7f/1m; may remain vulnerable over this trip
runners.spotlight: 10-24 on the AW with all wins coming over 7f/1m including three here; finished a close second of seven over this trip at Chelmsford (Polytrack) in January, but may still prove vulnerable to more established stayers.

quotes.race: Best Racing Odds Guaranteed At BetMGM Handicap
quotes.quote: Cephalus has been an old rogue, but we've learned that less is more with him at home where he has got rid of a few of his riders in the past - Tom Queally, jockey.

runners.name: Paradoxical
runners.comment: Six wins on the AW during the winter; 7lb above his last winning mark; needs to find extra
runners.spotlight: Six wins on the AW during the winter including a four-timer in February/March after the cheekpieces went on; endured a wide trip at Chelmsford (1m2f, Polytrack) 15 days ago, but is now 7lb above his last winning mark so needs to find something extra.

runners.name: Bajan Bandit
runners.comment: Has never been this far or raced on Polytrack before; others more solid
runners.spotlight: Running well on the AW this year including two wins on the Southwell Tapeta (7f/1m), but has never been this far or raced on Polytrack before; others more solid.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Extra Places Every Day Handicap
quotes.quote: Bajan Bandit made all when he won at Haydock then we were duped by a shower of rain half an hour before the race last time there and held him up. This looked a competitive event but he won well enough. At some point we'll try him over a mile again but there's no rush - Grant Tuer, trainer.

quotes.race: Due Diligence Standing At Whitsbury Manor British EBF Blagrave Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was very straightforward, very professional and Bahan Bandit travelled nicely. We thought we would sit back before getting a tone of the race but when the split came he got his head down and found the gap nicely. He was a little bit green at one stage, but his raw ability came through and he has hit the line strong. The ground is a touch quick for him so he will improve and he will come on massively from this run. He will improve with a bit more ease in the ground, but it shows that he is a good horse and he will go on anything - Cieren Fallon, rider.

stable_tour.quote: We bought him out of Richard Hannon's yard and when he arrived here he had a mark of 79 but his first run for us was disappointing. We felt a mile stretched him then and dropped him to 7f, which proved to be the right thing as he won at Haydock on his second run. He added to that at York in July off a mark of 80 and he's now shot up to 87. We tried him again over a mile last week at the Ebor meeting as there were no 7f alternatives and he ran a cracking race. That trip on fast ground is definitely him and it looks like there could be a big prize in him. He has a touch of class and it is onwards and upwards. Looking ahead there are options at Doncaster and York to consider. 30-08-23

runners.name: Hitched
runners.comment: Goes well here (511124); 1lb higher than when winning over C&D in January; each-way claims
runners.spotlight: Rarely runs a bad race and goes well here (511124); just 1lb higher than when winning over C&D in January and holds each-way claims.

runners.name: Tribal Wisdom
runners.comment: C&D winner but still 5lb above his last winning mark; others look better treated
runners.spotlight: C&D winner but a bit of a mixed bag around here lately; still 5lb above his last winning mark and others look better treated.

2:40.race_name: BetMGM All Weather Vase Mile Handicap

runners.name: Blue Prince
runners.comment: Involved in another tight finish over 7f latest; yet to prove as effective at 1m
runners.spotlight: In good form on different AW surfaces this winter and due to go back up 2lb for another narrow defeat, over 7f at Kempton last week; however, he still needs to show he's as effective at 1m.

quotes.race: 50K ITV7 Weekly Jackpot Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: Blue Prince picked up and put the race to bed very smartly. He's an improving colt who has plenty of ability in the tank - Cam Hardie, jockey.

runners.name: Sterling Knight
runners.comment: In good form since 1m win at Chelmsford in December, meeting one on a roll over C&D latest
runners.spotlight: Has continued in good form since winning at Chelmsford in December, having a healthy weights turnaround with Dembe on C&D form in January, then best of the rest behind one on a roll here in February; thereabouts.

quotes.race: Watch On Racing TV Handicap
quotes.quote: We played the same cards as last time here and although the ground is a bit softer today, Sterling Knight has absolutely thrived on it. I started to make a move at the three pole and the only place to go was the inside. Luckily, he had plenty in the tank to get through the gaps. When he hit the front he idled and waited for something to come upsides him again. He's done it well -- Rhys Clutterbuck, jockey.

quotes.race: Hascombe & Valiant Stud Handicap
quotes.quote: Sterling Knight is tough and durable and was entitled to run his race. It was a good performance at Windsor and he was going up 7lb, so we ran him with the penalty and 3lb off with Rhys, but he's definitely improving. He's strengthening and the handicapper can stop anything, but we hope this isn't the end of him. He's won over seven on the all-weather, but we just felt he wasn't seeing it out and he has a load of toe, so a stiff six here has really suited him. There's a good programme for three-year-old sprint handicappers and he'll have to follow it - Robin Trevor-Jones, travelling head lad.

runners.name: Farasi Lane

prev_owners.owner: M Webber, M T Ward & Schiff Family
M Webber, M T Ward & Schiff Family

runners.comment: Below best on turf latest but best Tapeta and Polytrack form puts him in the picture
runners.spotlight: Below best returned to turf at Doncaster (in refitted cheekpieces, discarded today) but he'd only just failed at Wolverhampton (extended 1m) the time before; he's seen little Polytrack action in the last 12 months but a sustained run paid off at Kempton (1m) last April; in the picture.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Daily Extra Places Handicap (London Mile Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Farasi Lane's homework had been brilliant and he was second here last month, which could be considered a career-best and that's amazing for a 6yo to still be improving. That's probably a career-best again and hopefully it shows what we can do with these older horses. There's a 0-90 on Guineas day I've been thinking about, although he might not get in it now - Jamie Insole, joint-trainer.

runners.name: Legal Reform
runners.comment: Two 7f wins here; in the form of his life at Southwell of late; big trip query back at 1m
runners.spotlight: Front-runs; never better than in 2025, over 7f at Southwell, and he lost his lead only late on there last month (Blue Prince close behind); he's also won twice on this track but staying 1m may prove as problematic as it's been in the past (last attempted in late 2022).

stable_tour.quote: He is a nice horse who has not done a great deal wrong. He won at Southwell in the spring and was a little unfortunate not to win at Chester in the summer when a head second to Praxeology. He is a genuine horse who likes the all-weather surfaces and appreciates cut underfoot. There are several races coming up in the next few weeks but I am waiting for the softer ground. The only all-weather track I will try and avoid with him is Kempton as he did not appear to enjoy his run around there last month. I am sure he will pick up a race or two this winter 23-09-21

runners.name: Dragon Icon
runners.comment: Sole win in C&D novice; running well on Tapeta until non-stayer at 1m2f since; competitive
runners.spotlight: Sole win in C&D novice as a 3yo; in good form on Newcastle Tapeta back from being gelded but he again didn't see out 1m2f here in February; useful effort in a strong 1m event on Kempton Polytrack last spring suggests he'll be competitive here.

quotes.race: British EBF Novice Stakes (Sire And Dam Restricted Race) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Dragon Icon is a lovely individual. It took him a few strides to get going and he picked up and I thought that was it and he was going to finish a nice fourth or fifth, but then he took off. He is a raw horse that wouldn't have been 100 per cent tuned up for this today as it was an educational experience - David Egan, jockey.

runners.name: Dembe
runners.comment: Easy winner at Newcastle latest; 2-2 over C&D; career-high mark but good claims
