runners.spotlight: Seemed to relish the return to Newcastle (1m) when winning easily in March but he found plenty when making it 2-2 over C&D previously and has never been in better form; on career-high mark back from short break but has to be respected again.

quotes.race: MansionBet Beaten By A Head Handicap
quotes.quote: Dembe missed the break and ran out a bit and got behind off a strong pace. I wasn't confident until the last 100 yards but he could come back here on Good Friday - Rossa Ryan, jockey.

runners.name: Sous La Neige
runners.breeder: Scea Haras De Saint Pair & Ecurie Peregrine Sas

prev_owners.owner: Scea Haras De Saint Pair & Mme Andre Fabre

runners.comment: French 5yo; chance on the pick of his turf/AW form; without regular tongue-tie; drawn wide
runners.spotlight: French challenger; sole win in 1m conditions race on Polytrack as 2yo; of interest on the pick of his turf and AW form but he's without his usual tongue-tie and the wide draw isn't helpful; others higher up the list.

runners.name: Bravo Zulu
runners.comment: Won last three 1m races by narrow margins, two over C&D; this asks for more
runners.spotlight: Leads or races prominently; has won his last three starts at about 1m, twice on this track, and although they've been by narrow margins he's kept his nose ahead of the handicapper; this asks for more in a higher grade.

stable_tour.quote: He went to Newmarket recently as something of a big hope, but it was his first run on turf and the ground was holding, while Richard Kingscote thought he was very green about it all. He thought he'd come on mentally for that, while he's got a great action so probably wants the top side of good ground. He works like a good horse and I'd like to think he could be a Royal Ascot horse for the Britannia or Golden Gates Stakes. We'll aim for a mile race on fast ground before that and he's quite similar in terms of ability to Outgate, who was a star for us before being sold to Hong Kong. 02-05-24

runners.name: Kalamunda
runners.comment: Won first five AW starts; just a shade flat over C&D latest; had short break since
runners.spotlight: Won first five AW starts and although Dembe was the more dramatic finisher of the two over C&D in January the latter is worse off at the weights now; may have been ready for a break when fading slightly here in February (closely matched with Sterling Knight) and could yet do a bit better.

runners.name: Longlai
runners.breeder: Mme Aliette Forien & Mr Gilles Forien
runners.owner: S Hassiakos, M Wigham & David Dixon
runners.comment: One course run back in 2021; in good form without much luck in running; more to do here
runners.spotlight: One course run back in 2021; won two in a row over about 1m at Kempton (dead-heated) and Wolverhampton last summer and has been in good form at Chelmsford this year, without much luck in running; has more to do this time.

quotes.race: Westwood Handicap
quotes.quote: Longlai is going the right way. He was gelded in the winter and that's made a difference to him - Silvestre de Sousa, jockey.

quotes.race: Shadwell Novice Stakes (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: Longlai is a little bit narrow and weak still, but finished his race off nicely today. I'd like to think he'll be a nice horse for next year. We'll speak to the King Power team and go from there, but he doesn't need to do a lot more this year. He could be a nice mile/mile-and-a-quarter horse for next year - Richard Hannon, trainer.

runners.name: Helm Rock
runners.comment: Just one Polytrack win back in 2023; faded over C&D behind Dembe in January; drawn widest
runners.spotlight: Multiple winner on turf and AW but just once on Polytrack, in 2023, and he dropped out after making much of the running behind Dembe and Kalamunda over C&D in January; has work to do from the widest draw.

quotes.race: Unibet London Mile Series Final Handicap (Series Final - Qualified horses Only)
quotes.quote: It's a great result. We only ran in the Racing League because the race looked winnable. The plan had been to come here and we did think the races were a bit close together, but Helm Rock has won 70,000GBP in ten days. He's won seven now and was the most expensive yearling we've ever bought, but he's paid it back. It's taken time but he's matured mentally and every year he's come back a bit better - Daniel Kubler - co-trainer.

quotes.race: J W Lees MPA Handicap
quotes.quote: Helm Rock just loves the soft ground and it's been tricky to find it this year. He handles the all-weather but you see the best of him in the mud; he's a true Pivotal - Claire Kubler, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: Wreay Handicap
quotes.quote: We debated the trip a bit for Helm Rock but he ran over a mile three times and didn't quite get it. He loved the ground and we'll see what options there are for him-Claire Kubler, joint trainer

stable_tour.quote: It looks like he's better on the all-weather all of a sudden. He's good on turf, but took off on the all-weather and ideally we'd like to get him back to Kempton for the series final he won last year. He's on a break and is one for the second half of the campaign. 02-05-24

runners.name: Dingle
runners.comment: Suited by return to front-running when Kempton winner (1m) latest; easy lead unlikely here
runners.spotlight: Was suited by the return to front-running when seeing off the challengers at Kempton (1m) in February; weighted to be involved on best C&D form but this will take more winning and an easy lead will be hard to secure.

quotes.race: Read Katie Walsh On Betway Insider Handicap
quotes.quote: Dingle goes well fresh so we were hopeful of a good run and I think the plan is to take come back here in April or the big meeting at Newcastle - Sean Levey, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He's unexposed and the form of his Kempton win in September has been well advertised with the second and the fourth winning since. He could run in the 7f handicap at Newbury on Friday 16-04-21

He's a three-time winner, the most recent at Newcastle over a mile in the spring off 78. He had a good time on the all-weather over the winter/spring and we're going to focus on a similar campaign for him again. He's having a nice break and is one to keep an eye out for in the winter. 06-09-23

runners.name: Sommelier
runners.comment: Not lived up to early promise but too much ability to discount dropped in class
runners.spotlight: 12 months ago he was sent off the 7-2 second favourite for the 3yo Championship off an 8lb higher mark; hasn't had much go right for him this winter but he's dropping in grade and the ability is still lurking; tongue tie and cheekpieces worn together for the first time (both worn independently at various stages).

runners.name: Prince Of Pillo
runners.comment: Easy C&D win in February; 5f too sharp latest; hood removed today; not discounted
runners.spotlight: Back to winning ways with a cosy C&D success in February; less good next time before finding 5f too sharp at Newcastle four weeks ago; return to this trip a positive and the removal of a hood could help too.

quotes.race: British EBF Stallions Harry Rosebery Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: The doubt was there because Prince Of Pillo had run the other day and we were backing him up quite quick. But if he hadn't been bumped at Doncaster he'd have been a comfortable third behind two very good two-year-olds. He's got so much natural pace and he's got a lovely relaxed attitude as well. I'd say he's a good one - Keith Dalgleish, trainer.

quotes.race: William Hill Ripon Hornblower Conditions Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I was really happy. Prince Of Pillo has so much speed and did that easily. He was a bit green the last furlong and was having a look at the big crowd, but he won that at half-speed - Callum Rodriguez, jockey.

runners.name: Amazonian Dream
runners.comment: On a winning mark but lacks course experience and could prove vulnerable
runners.spotlight: Back to his last winning mark and not seen to best effect at Kempton three weeks ago; lacks course experience though and others bring more pressing claims.

stable_tour.quote: He was a very good two-year-old but unfortunately he got cast one Sunday afternoon and shattered his pin bone. His pin bone is about four inches down his leg and we were lucky not to lose him. If he hadn't done that he'd have been a very good horse, and it's taken a  few years for him to get going again really but he's back in good from again now, winning the sprint qualifier at Windsor last week. He can be difficult to get on in the paddock, but changing the chute at Windsor to a new entrance further around the bend has made it easier for us to mount him, which is why we go back to Windsor as much as we can. He'll run in the sprint final there on August 12 all being well. He was a close fourth in it last year, but he's in better form this year. 11-07-24

runners.name: Mums Tipple
runners.comment: On a dangerous mark but the outside stall might prove an insurmountable obstacle
runners.spotlight: Well handicapped on even this winter's best and usually seen in a higher grade; overcoming the outside stall won't be easy though.

quotes.race: Bombardier Lady Wulfruna Stakes (Listed Race) (All-Weather Championships Fast-Track Qualifier)
quotes.quote: It's nice for the owners as Mums Tipple looked a serious horse at two but last year was a bit of a mess for many reasons. He ran a fine race at Lingfield and the step up to seven furlongs suited him. There were some good horses in there but the race went well for him and he did it nicely. He's a fast horse, started well and the race went smoothly - Ryan Moore, jockey.  Mums Tipple worked very well during the week and it's nice to see him back after his encouraging run at Lingfield. He's a very good horse and it's been a little bit unfair as he gets knocked every time he runs. People want to see a similar performance to what he did at York each time but that was one of the best performances I've seen by any horse - even I was shocked by that - and people haven't given him a break since that. He's got an awful lot of ability so it's nice to see him win, and win very well, at that level. Hopefully he can build on that for the rest of the year and we'll probably go for the Mile on Finals' Day - Richard Hannon, trainer.

quotes.race: Goffs UK Premier Yearling Stakes
quotes.quote: We thought Mums Tipple was a very nice horse when he won at Ascot but I haven't seen a horse of ours win like that for years. I'm not sure what strength of depth there was in the race but he looked pretty smart. He's one of the nicest horses we've had in terms of the way he looks, behaves and moves - he's a little bit different. He does his thing at home and to me he looks like he'll still improve. There are plenty of options for him but he's entered in all the big ones - Richard Hannon, trainer.

quotes.race: Anders Foundation British EBF Crocker Bulteel Maiden Stakes (Plus 10 Race) (Not Run More Than Once)
quotes.quote: Mums Tipple is a very nice colt, always has been. I think it's a very good race, there's been a lot of talk for a lot of horses there. He's done it the hard way making the running but he hit the gate well, he was in front for a long way so he's probably wanted the line. He's got a lot of scope - Richard Hannon, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's a talented Saturday horse and can be competitive from six furlongs to a mile. He's still very good on his day and will run in a lot of the big handicaps this season. I'd like to claim off him at some stage. 29-04-24

runners.name: Silky Wilkie
runners.owner: Middleham Park Racing Lxxxi & E Burke
runners.comment: Good 2nd over C&D in February; had excuses at Wolverhampton since; each-way shout
runners.spotlight: Returned from an unproductive spell in Dubai with a good second over C&D; caught wide in a race in which he couldn't get to the front at Wolverhampton last time; each-way contender back at this venue from a handy draw.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Ayr Gold Cup Handicap (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: We'd never put the visor on Silky Wilkie at home but I thought we had to try something different, I had a feeling he was saving something for himself and getting a bit wise. It obviously worked really well - Karl Burke, trainer.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Sunday Apprentice Training Series Handicap (Part Of The Racing Excellence Initiative)
quotes.quote: I love Silky Wilkie. He's so straightforward and genuine and is a dream for a jockey. My only concern going into it was the draw as a lot of the fancied ones seemed to be far side, and I was happy I was able to get in the middle. He's got a great cruising speed and can quicken as well - Sam Feilden, jockey.

quotes.race: Pepperells Solicitors Restricted Novice Stakes (For horses In Bands B, C And D) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Silky Wilkie did that quite nicely. The aim was not to hit the front too soon - Clifford Lee, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He's had an unbelievable campaign this winter/spring culminating with a win in the Scottish Sprint Cup at Musselburgh. We started off in November on a mark of 90 and he is now up to 108. Last time in the Abernant Stakes he possibly found the rise in class just one step too far, and I think he is now at the absolute ceiling of his ability and hopefully the handicapper will go easy on him. I am thinking about dropping him back to 5f for the Epsom Dash next time as he loves to go a fast pace and they don't go much quicker than down that hill. 07-05-23

runners.name: Cajetan
runners.comment: Had excuses following his emphatic Class 4 win in December; perhaps vulnerable again
runners.spotlight: Bolted up at Newcastle in December, a run which saw the handicapper take decisive action; he's come up short in stronger company since, albeit with excuses, and may do so once again.

stable_tour.quote: He was 2-2 on the all-weather in the spring, winning at Newcastle and Kempton. He then had a few issues this summer, so he only started his winter campaign on Saturday at Ascot, where he finished eighth behind Alcazan on his first run since May. He'll now go on to the all-weather for the winter. I really like him and I've made him my trainer's pick for the next few months. 10-10-24

runners.name: Cinque Verde
runners.comment: Good AW record includes a C&D win; not at her best 12 days ago; others look stronger
runners.spotlight: Her good record on AW includes a C&D win; impressed at Wolverhampton last month but she was unable to back it up at Southwell 12 days ago; looks the likely leader but suspect a few will be finishing quicker.

stable_tour.quote: She was in very good form on the all-weather earlier this year, winning five times between February and May. She was fifth at Windsor last week and then sixth there again on Saturday. She may go to Brighton, where she's entered in the Bullet on Friday. 07-08-24

runners.name: Crimson Sand
runners.comment: Fair stable debut at Southwell 12 days ago; fine over 6f but others look better treated
runners.spotlight: Ran creditably on his stable debut at Southwell 12 days ago and returning to 6f won't be a problem; not sure he's ahead of his mark though.

quotes.race: Betway Maiden Stakes
quotes.quote: Crimson Sand had a few niggly problems last year but this year he's been flawless and that was a good start. He was working well enough to go and win that so I'm delighted. We'll see what he gets but he'll be better over six than five - Richard Hughes, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: I have to say he has been a massive trainer balls-up. I ran him over 5f in a bad race at Lingfield in February to get him to win and he did it well. So we backed up over 6f six weeks later and he won again. We went to Ascot in May, but the ground was slow and I was disappointed with his effort. His owners were keen to go to Royal Ascot, so I ran him at Nottingham to make him eligible for the 5f race at the royal meeting, but he got beaten a length and a quarter having got left at the start. That was Ascot out of the window, so we sent him to Newmarket last month, where he did not see his race out over 5f. He has to have conditions like a road to be at his best. 14-07-21

runners.name: Pals Battalion
runners.comment: Thrived on AW since October, winning four times; no course form/wide draw the negatives
runners.spotlight: In fine form on AW since October, winning four times; the latest came in a small field at Newcastle but a 2lb rise isn't excessive; drawn wide and this is his first visit to Lingfield so there are negatives.

quotes.race: Gamble Responsibly At BetUK Handicap
quotes.quote: As I was angling out the race in front of me came that way so I switched off heels then I got carried a little bit but Pals Battalion won really comfortably - David Nolan, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Westmorian
runners.comment: Chasing a hat-trick after two easy Southwell wins; up 8lb in a better race at a new track
runners.spotlight: Better than ever this year, second at Newcastle on his return before recording two bloodless successes at Southwell (6f); 8lb higher mark, stronger opposition and a new track could leave him vulnerable.

stable_tour.quote: Right from the early days I have liked him and thought he had quite an engine, but largely he has been very frustrating. He was a neck off winning a 5f handicap at the back of last year and this term his first two runs at Hamilton and York have been good, but he flopped badly last time and I can offer no excuses for that effort. His penultimate run, when fourth behind Showtime Mahomes is solid form as the second, third and fifth have won since, but unfortunately not Westmorian. He has a mark of 74, which judged on that Knavesmire effort makes him a decently handicapped horse. I think he is another that once we find the key and get his head in front he could run up a sequence. 22-06-22

runners.name: Moulin Booj
runners.comment: Running well but not much in hand of this mark; now tried in cheekpieces
runners.spotlight: In good form on AW since November at both 5f and 6f; latest Southwell run saw him find less than expected and cheekpieces are now reached for.

stable_tour.quote: He's had a huge amount of issues but thankfully they all are behind him now. He's a very good-looking horse and I always anticipated he'd start winning races, so it wasn't a surprise to see him win last time out. He just needed his first run of the year and he got it right at Southwell. It's a lot easier to bridge a gap in sprint races than in middle-distance contests, so I think he'll run in some nice races and will continue to be competitive even up in grade. A track like Epsom would suit him very well and I could see him popping up in a nice race this season and picking up the pieces on the right day. 29-03-24

runners.name: Diamondonthehill
runners.comment: Running well in defeat for new yard this year but this sharp 6f asks a different question
runners.spotlight: Running well in defeat for his new yard this year but over further; the drop to 6f at this track might prove on the sharp side for him.

stable_tour.quote: He's a bit frustrating because he's got a lot more ability than he cares to show. The race didn't really pan out and they didn't go quick enough for him at Haydock last time when he finished seventh of nine. On his previous start at Thirsk he travelled like the best horse. He moved into contention and I think he would have won if he'd just put his best foot forward, but he finished second, beaten a neck by Cerulean Bay. He has a lot of ability if he'd just use it all. He's entered at Thirsk on Friday. 28-08-24

4:20.race_name: BetUK All-Weather Vase Marathon Handicap (GBBPlus Race)

runners.name: Tides Of War

prev_owners.owner: Mrs F Hay, M Tabor & Mrs J Magnier

runners.comment: Has regressed since winning at Goodwood last May, including in last three starts on the AW
runners.spotlight: Won off 6lb higher at Goodwood (1m6f, good) in May last year, but has regressed since, including in last three starts on AW; plenty to prove.

runners.name: Rogue Tornado
runners.comment: Has proved consistent on AW since last September including a win at Southwell last month
runners.spotlight: Has proved consistent on the AW since last September, including when winning at Southwell (1m6f, Tapeta) last month; has run well off this mark in both outings since and looks one for the shortlist.

stable_tour.quote: Another we acquired from Sheikh Hamdan's dispersal. This colt has a beautiful pedigree and is a fine, big specimen. He has done so well since we got him and is a beautiful mover. I'd imagine he will not be out until the second half of the season, but with that pedigree it will be next year when he will come into his own. I like him a lot. 30-03-22

runners.name: Optician
runners.comment: All five wins have come on the Wolverhampton Tapeta; first attempt over this far
runners.spotlight: All five wins have come over 1m4f/1m6f on the Wolverhampton Tapeta; finished fourth of 16 in the apprentice handicap on this card last year so does handle Polytrack, but has something to prove on his first attempt over this far.

runners.name: Dreams Adozen
runners.breeder: S A R L Al Shahania Stud France
runners.comment: Has failed to beat a rival in her last two starts so does have something to prove
runners.spotlight: Still just 1lb higher than when winning at Newcastle (2m, Tapeta) on New Year's Day, but she has failed to beat a rival in her last two starts; has a bit to prove.

quotes.race: Horseradish Catering & Events Fillies' Handicap
quotes.quote: Dreams Adozen handled the ground. It's absolutely bottomless but she ploughed through it, maybe the others didn't go in the ground - Joe Fanning, jockey.

runners.name: Red Flyer
runners.comment: One win in his last 26 starts, but is a proven stayer; 6lb below his last winning mark
runners.spotlight: Just one win in his last 26 starts, but he is a proven stayer and although beaten 5l when runner-up over C&D seven weeks ago, the winner was on a roll; still 6lb below his last winning mark and could go well.

runners.name: Pearl Jewel
runners.comment: Running well at Dundalk lately; interesting candidate under Silvestre De Sousa
runners.spotlight: Got off the mark in a Dundalk maiden (1m4f, Polytrack) in November and has run well in both handicaps there since (2m/1m4f), going down by a nose five weeks ago; interesting candidate under Silvestre De Sousa.

runners.name: Road To Wembley
runners.comment: Back off the same mark as when winning at Newcastle last August; worth a second look
runners.spotlight: Course winner (1m2f) who hasn't had things go his way since returning on the AW in January, but is back off the same mark as when winning at Newcastle (2m Tapeta) last August; worth a second look.

stable_tour.quote: He ran well at Haydock last time. In hindsight we might have gone a stride too quick, but there's another one in him over 2m. 18-09-24

runners.name: Comte De Loir
runners.comment: Has improved since handicapping; may still have more to offer; cheekpieces on
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 4yo who has improved since handicapping, including a narrow success at Kempton (2m, Polytrack) in January; cheekpieces now given a go and he may still have more to offer.

runners.name: Upepo
runners.comment: Running consistently well on the AW in recent months; well worth another go over this far
runners.spotlight: Running consistently well on the AW in recent months with wins over 1m4f here and at Wolverhampton (Tapeta); only just beaten back here (1m5f) this month (splitting Dance Time and Poncho) and looks well worth another go over this far; stable also runs The Craftymaster.

runners.name: The Craftymaster
runners.owner: S Barton, T Stamp, R Miles, & Partner
runners.comment: Dual C&D winner; capable of playing a part off this mark if somewhere near his best
runners.spotlight: Won seven times on the AW between December 2023 and March last year, including twice over C&D; recent form rather patchy but capable of playing a part off this mark if somewhere near his best.

quotes.race: BetUK. Home Of The Acca Handicap
quotes.quote: The Craftymaster has been a revelation. He used to be slow, but stayed. Now, when that was going to turn into a sprint, I was thinking you can't go wide as you'll never win, so just wait and see if you outstay them. He's put them to bed in half a furlong with his injection of speed. He's learning and getting better at everything he does. This was the first test of his mettle, a full field with horses who have been in very good form and he's up to it. I don't feel I'm at the bottom of him yet - I feel if something came at him he'd go again -  William Carson, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: BetUK. It's Where The UK Bets Handicap
quotes.quote: The Craftymaster has developed late and we've been very lucky to have him. He's progressing really nicely. He's going up the grades slowly and he's coping with it. He stays very well and he's lazy through his races, so you'd like to think there's always just a tiny little bit left. We'll keep going forward - Tony Carroll, trainer, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Gallant Lion
runners.comment: Losing run up to 14 and is yet to race beyond 1m4f on the Flat
runners.spotlight: Completed a turf four-timer for Tony Carroll in the summer of 2023, but 0-14 since; returns to the Flat after a couple of ordinary efforts over hurdles, but is yet to race beyond 1m4f on the level; stable won this last year.

runners.name: Poncho
runners.comment: C&D winner who should appreciate the return to this trip; shortlisted
runners.spotlight: Sole Flat win came off 1lb lower over C&D in December and he looked as though he would appreciate going back up in trip when third of six behind Dance Time and Upepo over 1m5f here this month; shortlisted.

runners.name: Further Measure
runners.comment: In great form on the AW since Boxing Day (21411113); respected under his 7lb claimer
runners.spotlight: In great form on the AW since Boxing Day (21411113); dangerous to think the handicapper has his measure after a third of eight at Southwell (16.5f, Tapeta) three weeks ago; especially with Alfie Redman taking off a handy 7lb; respected.

quotes.race: Â£30 In Free Bets With BetUK Handicap
quotes.quote: I thought Sean was further back than ideal and I was panicking a little bit but once Further Measure came up the straight he just kept finding. He's been unlucky in some races when they haven't gone a pace so today was pleasing. He's entered at Wolverhampton on Monday but we'll see how he comes out of this, he's eight now and he's been a great servant for us. We originally bought him for the apprentices to ride and he's at a stage where he's enjoying life so we're all delighted - Mike Murphy, trainer, talking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Dance Time

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late L R Owen

runners.comment: Three wins since November, the latest here (1m5f); no problem with the return to this trip
runners.spotlight: Three wins since November, the latest when just getting the better of Upepo and Poncho here (1m5f); up 2lb but no problem with the return to this trip and one to be interested in.

stable_tour.quote: She's done extremely well, putting on a serious amount of weight. I think she's put on 85kg since last season. She's a bull of a filly. How she did as well as she did at two and three is amazing really - she's a bit of an enigma. She has a super attitude. She's probably two or three weeks away from a run and I think we'll have some fun with her as she's very well-handicapped off 67. 30-05-24

1:30.race_name: BetUK All-Weather Vase Apprentice Handicap (GBBPlus Race)

runners.name: Way Of Life
runners.comment: Dual C&D winner but losing run up to 30; will do well to break his losing run in this
runners.spotlight: Completed a five-timer between November 2021 and May 2022 including two wins over C&D, but 0-30 since; will do well to break his losing run under top weight in this field.

quotes.race: Starlight Charity Remembers Christopher Hanbury Handicap
quotes.quote: Way Of Life is just growing up. He was so raw and ignorant and gormless as a younger horse and if he had ability he kept it well hidden, but we knew something was there. I hope he doesn't get crucified for that by the handicapper - Jonathan Portman, trainer.

runners.name: Charlies Choice
runners.comment: Found to have bled when tailed off at Wolverhampton last time; something to prove
runners.spotlight: Still just 1lb above his last winning mark, but was found to have bled when tailed off at Wolverhampton (9.5f, Tapeta) last time; something to prove after that.

quotes.race: Weekly Â£5 Free Bet With BetUK Handicap (Gbbplus Race)
quotes.quote: Charlie's Choice is ultra consistent and seems to like it here too. There wasn't much pace and we were able just to roll forward and get a position. He's a very willing partner and battled back well - Kieran Shoemark, jockey, talking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Civil Law
runners.comment: 5lb lower than when last successful, but this trip is beyond his best and drawn wide
runners.spotlight: Has dropped to a good mark, 5lb lower than when last successful, but this trip is beyond his best and his wide draw isn't ideal either.

quotes.race: Churchill Tyres Handicap
quotes.quote: Civil Law is in the Queen Mother Cup at York tomorrow and we'll see how he is. He's not blowing there and it's a 15,000GBP race. He could have done with a better gallop. Ben said they probably didn't go quick enough for him - Brian Ellison, trainer

runners.name: High Court Judge
runners.comment: Has enjoyed a fine 2025, but more is needed to defy this mark and drawn wider than ideal
runners.spotlight: Won six of his first seven starts of 2025 (including one over C&D), his last win coming off a 26lb higher mark than the first; should appreciate the return to this trip, but more is needed to defy this mark and is drawn wider than ideal.

runners.name: Patchs Bond
runners.comment: Beaten a short head by Tortured Soul over C&D in January; respected back over this trip
runners.spotlight: Only made his debut last August, winning a Kempton novice (1m, Polytrack) in November and going down by a short head to Tortured Soul on handicap debut over C&D in January; well held at Kempton (1m) last month, but better expected back over this trip.

runners.name: Shahbaz
runners.comment: 2-28 including a win at Chelmsford last time; still unproven over this far and drawn wide
runners.spotlight: Doubled his tally on his 28th start at Chelmsford (1m2f, Polytrack) 15 days ago; still lower than for his other win despite a 4lb rise, but he remains unproven over this far and isn't favoured by the draw; stable also runs Buxted Too.

stable_tour.quote: He progressed as the season went on last year culminating with victory over 1m1f in a Newmarket nursery off a mark of 82. This season he has had two runs, not troubling the judge on either occasion, and he was a bit disappointing last time out at Ascot over 1m2f, where they went no gallop which did not suit him. I am still not convinced he gets 1m2f as if you watch a replay of that race he is weakening as they approach the line. I did put him in the London Gold Cup last Saturday, but it was too dry to run him. I will give him another try over 1m2f and see, but I would not be surprised if we drop him back to a milen. The key to him is the race must be run at proper pace. 28-05-23

runners.name: Raintown
runners.owner: Ms Caroline Instone & J S Moore
runners.comment: 6-10 around here; his liking for this track means he has to be given an each-way shout
runners.spotlight: 6-10 around here including three wins over this trip; looks weighted to his best, but his liking for this track means that he has to be given an each-way shout.

stable_tour.quote: He won by five lengths at Lingfield and went up to a mark of 75. He still ran a nice enough race at Newbury but would probably need to be a bit lower-rated on the grass. He'll win plenty more but he seems to be more of an all-weather horse. He doesn't seem to transfer his all-weather form to grass. He'll be one to follow any time he's on the all-weather. He would still be ahead of the handicapper on that and there'd be a couple of very nice races for him on the all-weather. He's a very big horse and is getting stronger; he'll be a better type of horse with another six months on him. He's one of those late-maturing horses but he's won five races for us, which tells you the ability he's got. 04-07-24

runners.name: Party Island
runners.comment: Record over C&D reads 121171; back off the same mark as when winning here last May
runners.spotlight: Record over C&D reads 121171 and he has fared better with the draw than when seventh in this race last year; out of the frame in three starts since returning in February, but here have been signs of encouragement and he is back off the same mark as when winning here last May; interesting.

runners.name: Bearaway
runners.comment: Three wins on AW during the winter but disappointed last time; first start for new trainer
runners.spotlight: In fine form on the AW during the winter with three wins, two of them over 1m2f here; disappointed at Southwell (1m3f, Tapeta) last month, though, and needs to bounce back on his first start for his new trainer (same owners).

stable_tour.quote: After his only start last year he was lame and this season he started back at Southwell with an encouraging second and, yes you guessed it, he was lame again. His owner gave him to me last year due to this problem and the issue hasn't gone away but hopefully it'll improve with time. He's out in a field and will be back in the winter 04-08-21

runners.name: Sun Dancer Girl
runners.comment: Running well over further but is 2-2 over C&D; each-way claims granted a true pace
runners.spotlight: Has been running well in defeat over further since the end of last year, but she is 2-2 over C&D; still 3lb above her last winning mark, but holds solid each-way claims if this is run at a true pace.

quotes.race: starsportsbet.co.uk Handicap
quotes.quote: The way Sun Dancer Girl won at Lingfield last time filled me and the boss up with confidence that she would see the mile and six out. She's one of the first horses Nick had in with us and she's our first winner for him. She's a progressive filly - Callum Hutchinson, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Obsidian Knight
runners.comment: Five wins around here including one over this trip; still feasibly treated and a player
runners.spotlight: Won over C&D as a 4yo, but all five wins since have come over 1m2f including four here (the latest last month); 3lb higher but still feasibly treated on previous form and a player.

quotes.race: Huge Daily Boosts Only At BetUK Handicap
quotes.quote: Obsidian Knight has won round here three times now but I wouldn't say he has to come here. What he needs is a proper gallop, and he got one today. We're looking forward to running him on the turf, but whether we give him a break or go for one of the bonuses, I'll speak to the owners and see what they want to do. He seems to handle the track lovely and Tom gave him an absolutely perfect ride - Terry Kent, trainer.

runners.name: Tortured Soul
runners.breeder: Lofts Hall Stud, B Sangster, New England

prev_owners.owner: David Spratt & Sean Jones & Mrs Lynne Lyons

runners.comment: 8-17 on the AW including two wins over C&D; consistent, but drawn wider than ideal
runners.spotlight: Ultra-consistent performer who is 8-17 on the AW including two wins over C&D, the latest in January; runner-up in all three starts on the Southwell Tapeta (1m3f/1m4f) since then (last two off this mark), but he is drawn wider than ideal.

quotes.race: Unibet More Extra Place Races Handicap
quotes.quote: Tony [Carroll, trainer] said to take my time as Tortured Soul is an easy ride and to ride him with confidence as he's the best horse in the race. The key for him is getting him to relax and when they sprinted into the straight I knew I had plenty of horse to coax and to get there as late as possible. He's done it well and is racking up a few wins - Neil Callan, jockey, speaking on Racing TV.

runners.name: Caramay
runners.comment: Back off last winning mark, but all five AW wins have come on Tapeta; something to prove
runners.spotlight: Back off the same mark as when successful at Southwell (1m3f) in January, but all five AW wins have come on Tapeta and she was well held in one go on Polytrack, albeit when 200-1 for a Kempton maiden; something to prove.

runners.name: Destinado

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late K Abdullah

runners.comment: Dual winner around here and beat a big field at Doncaster last time; not opposed lightly
runners.spotlight: Dual winner here (1m2f/1m5f) and he beat 18 rivals in a Doncaster apprentice event (1m2f, good to soft) under Mason Paetel last time; bit more needed from 5lb higher, but he isn't opposed lightly.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Build A Bet Handicap
quotes.quote: Destinado is a very tough horse who's been very consistent since he joined James. This is his trip, he broke well and travelled nicely throughout the race - Aidan Keeley, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He's a lovely little horse who helped to put us on the map. He went off the boil a bit but ran really well again when he was third at Southwell just before Christmas. Unfortunately, when he won at Lingfield a few starts back, he won by too far, so he shot up in the handicap and we're just having to fight that a little bit at the moment. 01-01-25

runners.name: Bulldog Spirit
runners.comment: Return to this trip should suit, but he has it all to do from stall 16
runners.spotlight: Mixed fortunes lately, finishing over 4l behind Destinado at Doncaster (1m2f, good to soft) last time; return to this trip should suit, but he has it all to do from stall 16.

runners.name: Buxted Too
runners.comment: Eight AW wins including two over C&D, but this company may be a shade warm for him now
runners.spotlight: Eight of his nine wins have come on the AW including two over C&D at the beginning of 2023; won at Kempton (1m4f, Polytrack) in February, but this company may be a shade warm for him now.

runners.name: Dark Lyric
runners.comment: Promise at 7f/1m last year; shade to prove off this mark on handicap debut after a break.
runners.spotlight: Maiden; showed promise all starts at 7f and 1m last year, even though unable to get involved back over this trip at Southwell in December; shade to prove off this mark on handicap debut after a break.

runners.name: Get Jiggy With It
runners.comment: Sole win in 7f maiden; not badly treated and return to 7f can suit; cheekpieces added
runners.spotlight: Sole win in 7f maiden for Charles Hills but she went down only narrowly in a Thirsk handicap at that trip in September and is now 2lb lower; hasn't shot the lights out for new yard as yet but the return to 7f can suit and adding cheekpieces may also help.

runners.name: Alcazan
runners.comment: Multiple wins but on a long losing AW run and has her work cut out again
runners.spotlight: Multiple winner, the latest three on turf in 2024, but she hasn't won on the AW for nearly three years and recent runs on sand suggest she has her work cut out again.

quotes.race: Read Katie Walsh On Betway Insider Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: We were umming and ahing over whether the drop back to six furlongs would suit, but Alcazan has enjoyed that and bowled along nicely. I did think at one point we were tapping a bit too soon but I managed to get a breather into her at the three-furlong pole and she's gone on again round the bend - Laura Coughlan, jockey.

runners.name: Liv My Life

prev_owners.owner: Ian Wight, Tony Lyons And Ptnr
Ian Wight, Mrs Teresa Lyons And Ptnr

runners.comment: Wide-margin 7f winner at Southwell in January; back on better mark again; surface query
runners.spotlight: Back to best when coming well clear at Southwell (7f) in January and although unable to compete after going smartly back up the weights she fared better at Southwell (1m) recently until stamina gave out; the return to 7f will suit but she needs to show she's as effective on Polytrack.

runners.name: Blufferonthebus
runners.comment: Three turf wins at 6f-1m; 0-4 on AW but creditable 4th to Party Bear at Southwell latest
runners.spotlight: Three turf wins at 6f-1m; 0-4 on AW and although it was Party Bear who finished with the most conviction when they were first and fourth at Southwell (7f) recently she still put up a good show; can be involved.

runners.name: Eazy On The Eye
runners.comment: Two front-running 1m wins at Wolverhampton; now back at 7f on Polytrack debut
runners.spotlight: Well suited by the step up to about 1m when making all at Wolverhampton on final 2yo starts; entitled to have needed her recent comeback run but the return to 7f on Polytrack debut raises a question.

runners.name: Handle With Care
runners.comment: All races at 6f, improving to win on 2nd handicap run; needs extra for new trip
runners.spotlight: All races at 6f, improving to win here in March on second attempt in a handicap and keeping on in third after ridden prominently at Wolverhampton since; probably needs extra for the new trip.

runners.name: Scattering Light
runners.comment: Won 6f maiden at Wolverhampton in March; not clear run since; trip query back at 7f
runners.spotlight: Best effort so far when winning 6f Wolverhampton maiden in March and there wasn't much of a gap to go through when trying to challenge on handicap debut there since (1.5l behind Handle With Care); might have needed the run when fading over 7f in one previous attempt; not ruled out.

runners.name: Baileys Jubilation
runners.owner: Baileys Horse Feeds (F H Nash Ltd)
runners.comment: Busy 2yo who won a 5f novice on turf here; needs more for the new trip
runners.spotlight: Busy 2yo whose win came in a 5f turf novice here; has form at 6f and likely better for the run when fifth to Handle With Care here last month but she does have something to prove upped to 7f.

runners.name: Lady Manzor
runners.comment: Won C&D novice and 7f Kempton handicap; solid 3rd latest; drawn widest; still interesting
runners.spotlight: Has come on mightily over the winter, winning a C&D novice and a 7f Kempton handicap with authority before doing her best work late from off the pace in a stronger race there since; drawn widest; still of interest.

runners.name: Party Bear
runners.comment: Improved for 7f handicaps; 1lb well in under penalty for cosy Southwell win; new surface
runners.spotlight: Showed promise at sprint trips but she's come into her own in 7f handicaps, following a Wolverhampton win with an emphatic one at Southwell ten days ago; 1lb well in under penalty; has more to come if the new surface works for her.

runners.name: Mayo County
runners.comment: Ready win over 6f at Newcastle; 3rd off 7lb higher since; also has 7f form on Polytrack
runners.spotlight: Improved form when not having to work hard to win at Newcastle (6f) last month but things didn't work out so well off 7lb higher there (still ran well in third) next time; remains of interest as she also has form at 7f on Polytrack.

runners.name: Dandy Magic
runners.comment: Polytrack debut; won over 6f at Newcastle in January; looks worth another go at 7f
runners.spotlight: Polytrack debut; her win was over 6f at Newcastle in January but she persevered well over that trip at Southwell in February and, after perhaps needing her recent return from a break, she's worth another go at 7f.

runners.name: Naughty Eyes
runners.comment: Winning debut in 6f AW maiden; well beaten behind Lady Manzor on handicap debut (7f)
runners.spotlight: Successful debut in 6f Wolverhampton maiden as 2yo but has twice finished behind Lady Manzor, markedly so on handicap debut at Kempton (7f); up against it unless first-time cheekpieces prove a big asset.

runners.name: Kiniro
runners.comment: C&D winner; shaped well when second at Kempton on handicap debut; capable of better
runners.spotlight: Improved with each start, following his C&D win in January with a close second on his handicap debut at Kempton two weeks later (7f); left the impression a return to a well-run 6f would suit on that occasion and he remains capable of further progress; likely he'll need some luck from the inside stall but he's an intriguing contender.

runners.name: Tuco Salamanca
runners.comment: Three wins over further this year; drops back in trip with a tongue tie added
runners.spotlight: Had wind surgery in November and he's shown the benefit of it this year, winning a 7f maiden at Kempton in February and adding handicap wins at Wolverhampton (8.6f) and here (7f) in March; only fourth at Southwell 16 days ago and hopes rest on the tongue-tie and drop to 6f sparking another surge of improvement.

runners.name: The Actor
runners.owner: G B Turnbull Ltd & Julie Camacho
runners.comment: No show in two runs for new yard this year; change of headgear not enough to tempt
runners.spotlight: Consistent rather than progressive for Richard Hannon; gelded prior to a low-key stable debut at Southwell in February; another modest effort last time (after a wind op); edging down the weights but comes here with plenty to prove; visor now tried (has worn cheekpieces the last twice).

quotes.race: Tattersalls Â£40,000 EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: The Actor is a tough little horse and a real two-year-old. He's improved for that first run and I think he'll be better over further too. At this time of year you're trying to get a team together for Royal Ascot and he'd be in the mix for that. You have to keep a lid on him mentally, and Sean said he was a little bit naughty at the start, but he'll get better - Richard Hannon, trainer.

runners.name: Coul Angel
runners.comment: Won two of his last three starts and his C&D fifth in between came in a warm race; solid
runners.spotlight: Solid form when winning a 6f Kempton novice in January; only fifth on his handicap debut (C&D) but that was a strong race and he resumed winning ways at Southwell five weeks ago; 3lb rise manageable and he's not yet fully exposed.

runners.name: Tattie Bogle
runners.comment: 6f Tapeta winner as a 2yo; well beaten on handicap debut; opposable from wide draw
runners.spotlight: Was able to dictate a steady pace when winning a 6f maiden at Newcastle in November; gelded afterwards; low-key handicap debut at Kempton 11 days ago and he looks up against it from the widest stall.

runners.name: Backspin
runners.owner: Cognition Land And Water & M Clarke
runners.comment: Rewarded strong support with a ready 6f win on handicap debut; big chance despite 6lb rise
runners.spotlight: Promise in three novice runs and he picked up really well to reward strong market support on his handicap debut at Southwell seven weeks ago (6f); 6lb higher in a stronger race but it may well not be enough to stop him.

quotes.race: Boost Your Acca At BetMGM Handicap
quotes.quote: Every stride Backspin was learning there. Going past the line, he's pricked his ears when he hit the front, but he's done it good in the end. I made him get on and get the job done. I was happy - Finley Marsh, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Rock Hunter
runners.owner: D Macauliffe, A Don & Lds Bloodstock

prev_owners.owner: D Macauliffe, A Don & D De Souza

runners.comment: Recent return to action at Southwell (5f) was encouraging; dangerous mark but tricky draw
runners.spotlight: Yet to add to his debut win in France one year ago but he was often highly tried at two; encouraging return to action at Southwell (5f) last month and moving back up in trip may help; awkward draw but on a dangerous mark.

runners.name: The Flying Seagull
runners.owner: Two Plus Three Two Plus Four
runners.comment: Third behind Coul Angel on penultimate start but failed to fire 11 days ago
runners.spotlight: Ran well for third behind Coul Angel at Southwell last month but he was unable to back it up at Kempton 11 days ago (patiently ridden from a wide stall); others appeal more for win purposes.

stable_tour.quote: He's a fun sprinter who goes round Chester well. He was probably beaten by the draw on his second start since being gelded at Southwell last month but there are more races to win with him. He had a terrible draw last time but ran perfectly well. The key thing is he's qualified to run at Lingfield on Good Friday. 09-04-25

runners.name: Ay Gee Ell
runners.comment: Two best efforts have come at 5f but races as though this trip should suit better; chance
runners.spotlight: Promising effort at Wolverhampton (5f) on his second start and ran on for a never-dangerous second on his handicap debut back at Wolverhampton 13 days ago; capable of better and 6f should suit; each-way shout.

runners.name: Soldiers Star
runners.comment: Form of his winning handicap debut (7f) last month looks solid; respected up 4lb
runners.spotlight: Placed in three novice/maiden runs this winter before making all to win a 7f handicap at Kempton six weeks ago; 4lb higher today but that form looks solid and he could have more to offer.

stable_tour.quote: He'll probably go to Lingfield on Good Friday for the valuable 0-80 handicap and I think he's progressive. He missed most of his two-year-old season but that's given him the time to strengthen and grow, and he could win plenty of races. 09-04-25

runners.name: Mcintosh
runners.comment: Hung left when beaten fav on handicap debut (7f); promising over 6f beforehand; unexposed
runners.spotlight: Confirmed the promise of his debut second at Chelmsford by winning a 6f maiden at Wolverhampton last month; hung left when a beaten favourite on his handicap debut at Kempton three weeks ago (7f); capable of better.

runners.name: Vocal Legend
runners.comment: Easy win at Southwell in February when dropped to 6f; yard going well; contender
runners.spotlight: Proved well suited by the drop to 6f when easily accounting for four rivals at Southwell in February; the runner-up has won a handicap since and the yard is going well; capable of better.

2:10.race_name: Auguste Rodin Coolmore Prix Cleopatre (Group 3) (3yo Fillies) (Turf)

runners.name: Benamira
runners.owner: Exors Of The Late H H Aga Khan

runners.name: Danara
runners.breeder: Ecurie Des Monceaux, Sunderland Holding Inc Et Al
